session_synopses.AD_ButcherReadsManuscript: The Colony Butcher, Chop, reacts to interacting with a mind flayer manuscript.

DaisyAD_ThroughPrison.text: An illithid oubliette. Right beneath the Towers. A colony must be close. That must be where the tadpoles are coming from.

session_synopses.DaisyAD_ThroughPrison: On arrival in colony. Through prisonAn illithid colony. Right under the tower. This must be where they are getting the tadpoles.

PAD_BrinePool.speaker: Player
PAD_BrinePool.text: No tadpoles in this brine pool.

session_synopses.PAD_BrinePool: A PAD reacting to the brine pool in the Tadpoling Centre in the Colony. The player will interact with the brine pool and play this dialog. If a player succeeds a perception check and fishes out the last remaining tadpole, a different node will be played.

session_synopses.AD_Rapid05: Quick-fire Elder Brain ADs in the Colony corridors. If the party attacked Ketheric on the Moonrise Rooftop, there will be more frantic, fast-paced ADs from the Elder Brain surrounding us in quick succession, similar to when we approach the Elder Brain in the Morphic Pool. In this flow, the evacuation of the Colony is a lot more pressing because Ketheric was attacked.
session_synopses.AD_Rapid03: Quick-fire Elder Brain ADs in the Colony corridors. If the party attacked Ketheric on the Moonrise Rooftop, there will be more frantic, fast-paced ADs from the Elder Brain surrounding us in quick succession, similar to when we approach the Elder Brain in the Morphic Pool. In this flow, the evacuation of the Colony is a lot more pressing because Ketheric was attacked.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: All of this, sitting beneath Moonrise. For how long? And how deep does it go?
PAD.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel line: teh-LA TAHV-key (spirits guide me)

session_synopses.PAD: PAD discussing the Colony, how eerie it is, and reflecting on the (similar) nautiloid at the beginning of the game.Started through COL_Entrance_VBFor Wyll: discussing either his mission to save his father or Mizora.

AD_Minthara_WitnessedBrainDevice.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_WitnessedBrainDevice.text: A splendid device. All the benefits of a cleric, no gods required.

PAD_DefeatedKetheric.speaker: Player
PAD_DefeatedKetheric.text: An elder brain... That was the Heart of the Absolute?
PAD_DefeatedKetheric.context: NodeContext: Almost to self, processing this information

AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.text: *Desperation... pain... terror. Cultists raided his village - he was the sole survivor.*

AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer.text: *The device does not react to your presence.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *You remember the shattered windows of Elturel's High Cathedral, the burning black sky of Avernus beyond.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *In its horror, the Blood War unites you. Tiefling, dwarf and elf alike huddle behind the shields of your paladin order, waiting for salvation. But when it comes... disunity.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *The returned city casts your people out, the devils who dragged them down to hell. In the end, it is not your paladin oath that is broken: it is your faith itself.*

Pods.speaker: Narrator
Pods.text: *You connect to the device, and gain control of the pods - and the fate of their occupants.*

Pods.speaker: Narrator
Pods.text: *The device is open to your tadpole's command - to your authority.*

PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole.speaker: Player
PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole.text: An unusual parasite, here. It's - it's reaching out to me.

AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.text: *Courage... conviction... defiance. Even as her organs began to dissolve, she believed she could resist.*

AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.text: *Delirium... mania... laughter. His mind broke before the end, and he was laughing uncontrollably as the skin fell from his face.*

DaisyAD_BrinePool.text: Brine pools... but empty of tadpoles. Unusual. Harvesting all the larvae indicates they are getting ready for something big.

AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty.text: *The device does not react to your presence.*

PAD_MizoraPodComment.speaker: Player
PAD_MizoraPodComment.text: That pod - is that Mizora inside?

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.text: *Your lungs burn with the dry heat of the fires raging about you, but the pain is not enough to diminish your swing. One goblin after another falls to your blade.*

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.text: *A man's voice cries out through the thick smoke. 'Ravengard!' you call, but the clang of swords and the spell-shouts of attacking drow are your only reply.*

AD_Minthara_EnteredTadpolingCenter.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredTadpolingCenter.text: This place has been used to make slaves of those who should be masters.

AD_MemoryImprint_001_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_001_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_001_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_001_Mindflayer.text: *Amusement... curiosity... fascination. He believed the horrors of Moonrise to be a fleeting dream that fade on waking.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.text: *Though the pod is empty, traces of psychic energy still linger around it, and memories of its former inhabitant spill into your mind.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.text: *You see the streets of Baldur's Gate... the emblem of the Flaming Fist... martial drills and courtly dances.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.text: *You feel the courage of a soldier who became a commander, and the intelligence of a commander who became a Duke.*

AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard.text: *Ravengard was here, in this pod, not long ago.*

AD_Zevlor_Combat.speaker: Zevlor
AD_Zevlor_Combat.text: Enough! My mind is my own!

session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer: AD for a memory imprint on an empty pod in the Tadpoling Centre.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor: AD for Zevlor's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from before he was imprisoned here.
session_synopses.Pods: Interacting with the mind flayer device in the Tadpoling Centre that controls the pods inside. You get to choose whether to free or purge the occupants of the pods - mind flayers and innocents alike.
session_synopses.PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole: The party reacts to spotting a special tadpole in one of the brine pools of the Colony Tadpoling Centre. It can be used for the tadpole powers tree.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_BrinePool: Brine pools. But they’ve been harvested. They should be full of tadpoles.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty: AD for an empty pod's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from whoever was imprisoned here before.
session_synopses.PAD_MizoraPodComment: Players comment when approaching Mizora's pod in the back of the Tadpoling Centre, provided she is there.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva: AD for Flaming Fist Yeva's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from before she was imprisoned here.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_001_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_010_Empty_Ravengard: AD for an empty pod's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from Duke Ravengard, who was imprisoned here before.
session_synopses.AD_Zevlor_Combat: Zevlor is freed from his imprisonment in one the pods in the Colony Tadpoling Centre. This AD is played on his first combat turn with the mind flayers that were also released from the pods.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The door pulses in recognition.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *But in denial, too. It will not open, even for you.*

session_synopses: Dialogue when approaching the door at the end of the Colony that precedes the Ketheric Showdown - once you're inside, it remains locked from the inside until Ketheric is defeated.The COL_EntranceDoor_State_Outside flag indicates on what side the player is.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: So much blood. The illithids take what's useful and discard the rest.

session_synopses.PAD: The player reacts to the view of the Oubliette's bloodbath aquarium from inside the Colony kitchen.

AD_SkullLasher_001_Combat.speaker: Hairy Henry
AD_SkullLasher_001_Combat.text: You will beg for death long before we grant it!

AD_Minthara_EnteredBarracks.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredBarracks.text: Some who worked here were not thralls or undead. They were loyal to Ketheric and his grim cause.

SkullLasher_001.speaker: Hairy Henry
SkullLasher_001.text: Heed the Mistress. She is blessed.

session_synopses.AD_SkullLasher_001_Combat: Hairy Henry, one of three Skull Lashers in the Colony Barracks, combat AD. Played only once.
session_synopses.SkullLasher_001: Default dialogue with Hairy Henry, one of the Skull Lashers in the Colony Barracks. Overseen by Krustine, Mistress of Souls. Shouldn't have too much to say. A male bugbear. (Myrkulite)

DaisyAD_GrandDesignReaction.text: The Grand Design. The restoration of the mind flayer empire. The dream of all illithids.

PAD_PuzzleSolved.speaker: Player
PAD_PuzzleSolved.text: That should do it. Time to see what's back there.

session_synopses.DaisyAD_GrandDesignReaction: Daisy reacts to seeing an illithid sculpture of the Grand Design.
session_synopses.PAD_PuzzleSolved: The party reacts to solving the mind flayer "mind puzzle" in the Colony Vault, near the Necro-Lab. Solving the puzzle unlocks a door where you can find the rewards.

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: You said it was under control.
ChosenThree.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric and Gortash stand by the chamber's centre, squaring off. Nearby, Orin completes the circle, sitting at her leisure on Ravengard by the brine pool.

ChosenThree.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree.text: It isn't you I answer to, Gortash.

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: Oh, the General voice. Is this where we salute?

ChosenThree.speaker: Orin
ChosenThree.text: Salute, yes, with cleavers through his blood-starved flesh. How it crawls with failure like flies on lick-wet carrion.

ChosenThree.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree.text: You forget yourself, Orin. I have played my part.

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: You've built an army for our masters, true enough. But what of the Astral Prism?

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: A rogue True Soul, flaunting it under your nose all this time. And you ran from them.

ChosenThree.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree.text: Sure that they would follow, and deliver it into my hands here. If you would cease these distractions -

DaisyAD_ElderBrain.text: An elder brain... One of the cruellest and most powerful creatures in existence, enslaved by mere mortals.

DaisyAD_EntranceDoor.text: We've found it. The Absolute is behind this door.

PAD_NightsongCaged.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongCaged.text: So long as Nightsong's in that cage, Ketheric will keep getting back up.

AD_Phase3Transition.text: UNLIFE TO MY LIFE - SUSTAIN ME, SLAVES.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: There you are. As predicted. What is it, I wonder, that draws one toward death like a moth to light?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: You could have run away. Absconded with the Prism - the one thing that could prevent me from fulfilling my destiny.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: But the lure of one's destiny is irresistible, isn't it?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: Perhaps you hoped to learn your place in history before you are erased from it. A bright flash of clarity before the snuffing-out.

KethericIntro.speaker: Player
KethericIntro.text: Why is the Prism so important to you?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: The very fact of your being attests to its power - despite your infection, you resisted the brain, here in the heart of its domain.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: What good is an army of thralls if they do not obey their master?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: My Lord Myrkul gave me the one thing I desired - the one thing that no other god could grant me.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: My daughter's life returned. Her heart beating once more.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: For that, he asked that I serve as his Chosen, join Orin and Gortash to grow the cult of the Absolute, and then... take control of it.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: He's never had a more devoted follower.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: I have fought great wars before, in the service of other gods, and other powers. But for Myrkul, I would condemn all of Faerûn to death.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: You are all that stands between me and my destiny - and you have brought the Prism here.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: I will kill you now. And then I will raise you as my servant.

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.text: Impossible... death cannot take me... I am its master...
KethericDefeated.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Apostle lurches back as the final blow is struck. It sinks towards the ground, growing more insubstantial as it falls. 

It fades to nothing, leaving only Ketheric, who staggers, holding a hand to a bloody wound over his heart

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.context: CinematicNodeContext: calling out to his god, hands held wide, displaying the wound for the cameraNodeContext: growing desperation as you call on your god

KethericDefeated.text: CinematicNodeContext: he falls to his knees
KethericDefeated.context: CinematicNodeContext: he falls to his knees

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.context: CinematicNodeContext: head bowed, he speaks from his knees, fear in his voiceNodeContext: fear in your voice - tried to speak to your god, but there was no response

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.text: You... you have no idea what you've done.

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.context: CinematicNodeContext:  he locks eyes with the player on the first 'you', a horrified expression on his face. The flesh falls away after he has spoken, leaving only a skull, that crashes to the ground, rolling away from his armour, now containing little but dust and shattered bones

KethericApostle.text: No... there is no repentance... no release. My debt can never be repaid.
He is watching. He is listening. He is... he is...

KethericApostle.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Ketheric staggers, gripped by some unseen power, and falls into the brine pool.*NodeContext: In awe and fear

KethericApostle.text: You dare end one who belongs to me?
KethericApostle.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice resounds from within the pit - the voice of Myrkul.

KethericApostle.text: I am the smile of the worm-cleansed skull. I am the regrets of those who remain, and the restlessness of those who are gone.
KethericApostle.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice resounds from within the pit - the voice of Myrkul.NodeContext: This should now be Myrkul's voice rather than Ketheric's. Will require SFX processing

KethericApostle.text: I am the haunt of mausoleums, the god of graves and age, of dust and dusk.
KethericApostle.context: CinematicNodeContext: A voice resounds from within the pit - the voice of Myrkul. A light glows from within.NodeContext: Myrkul voice

KethericApostle.text: I am Myrkul, Lord of Bones, and you have slain my Chosen.
KethericApostle.context: CinematicNodeContext: The light grows brighter as a mist rises from the mist - something is forming within it.NodeContext: Myrkul voice
CinematicNodeContext: The light grows brighter as a mist rises from the mist - something is forming within it.NodeContext: Myrkul voice

KethericApostle.text: For I am Death. And I am not the end - I am a beginning.
KethericApostle.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Apostle form emerges from the VFX display and hefts its scythe, preparing for combatNodeContext: Myrkul voice

PAD_AfterCombatComment.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterCombatComment.text: The Chosen of Myrkul is dead - permanently, this time.
PAD_AfterCombatComment.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's distracted. More focused on Gortash.

AD_KethericInvulnerable.text: Have you not learned? I am beyond death, fool.

DaisyAD_GrabNetherstone.text: Ketheric's Netherstone - it's in his armour. Take it.

session_synopses.ChosenThree: Upon entering the Ketheric boss chamber on the lower floor of the Colony, the party will see a cinematic of the Chosen Three gearing up to continue on to the next stage of their master plan. Ketheric, Orin and Gortash will be discussing the next steps and the tension caused by the player's actions. Ketheric tadpoles Duke Ravengard and we lay eyes upon the Elder Brain in the flesh. Orin and Gortash depart with the Duke and the Elder Brain in a nearby Nautiloid to march onto Baldur's Gate. We see the Nautiloid appear above Moonrise Towers and cue the armies of the Absolute to start marching. Ketheric stays behind to deal with some local issues.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_ElderBrain: The Elder Brain. One of the cruelest and most powerful creatures that exist. Subservient to those three. And those gems seem to be the key. We must obtain them.
session_synopses.PAD_NightsongCaged: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, while the combat has started and Nightsong is still soul caged. The players must free her before Ketheric can be damaged. Once the first (speaker available) player gets their turn in combat, this AD will play on them.
session_synopses.AD_Phase3Transition: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when the third phase of the fight starts, this will play only once on Ketheric when his turn starts. Ketheric, in his Apostle of Myrkul form, calls upon the Necromites to sacrifice themselves to heal him.
session_synopses.KethericIntro: This dialog plays at the start of the Ketheric boss fight in the Colony. There are numerous permutations here: Nightsong being dead or alive, freed from her soul cage (through stealth before being spotted); Isobel being absent or tadpoled or tadpoled and killed (in the boss chamber) before entering the dialog; Jaheira being present here (and spotted) or being absent.
session_synopses.KethericDefeated: NOTE TO PITSTOP: We have a cinematic previz of this so be sure to ping for that if we haven't already sent it to you.This dialog plays after defeating Ketheric once and for all at the Colony Ketheric Showdown. Ketheric delivers a short speech before he dies.- If Nightsong's corpse is present in the chamber, she will revive. If she is alive by this point she will comment on finally being rid of Ketheric.
session_synopses.KethericApostle: This dialog shows Ketheric transforming into his second phase - the Apostle of Myrkul. This can either happen by beating Ketheric in his first phase or by convincing Ketheric of the error in his ways, provided the right conditions are met.
session_synopses.PAD_AfterCombatComment: A PAD commenting on defeating Ketheric in his Apostle form at the end of the mind flayer Colony. After this the player will say that they need to go discuss the next course of action with their allies (alluding to Intermezzo in Moonrise Tower).At this point the players should take Ketheric's Netherstone (but we can't ensure that a player hasn't already looted said netherstone off his corpse by the time that end node is played).If there are two players available, they will banter together, otherwise a solo PAD will play.
session_synopses.AD_KethericInvulnerable: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when the player tries to damage Ketheric while he is invulnerable (Nightsong is still in the soul cage). Ketheric will react to the damage attempt. This will play if Ketheric is in his human form.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_GrabNetherstone: After the fight with Ketheric, Daisy asks us to grab Ketheric's Netherstone.

session_synopses.Corpse_Dead: The Speak With Dead dialog for the default fallback corpse that drops from the Cleansing Chute corpse. This corpse only appears when another minor character (presumably one of the tieflings) shouldn't end up dead here for some reason.

Butcher_FreedUs.speaker: Chop
Butcher_FreedUs.text: NO! Creature was wrong - Other. But mine to fix.

Butcher_FreedUs.speaker: Chop
Butcher_FreedUs.text: ... no. Please. I hear. I obey.
Butcher_FreedUs.context: NodeContext: Broken - wilting under the threat of punishment from us

AD_Butcher_Idle.speaker: Chop
AD_Butcher_Idle.text: Pretty faces go chop... faces? No - no faces, only meat. Never think, never stop. Only chop. Chop. CHOP.
AD_Butcher_Idle.context: NodeContext: Brief note of lucidity on '...faces?' as he seems momentarily aware of his condition - then shakes it off and returns to his work rhythm a little more forcefully.

Us.speaker: Us
Us.context: NodeContext: Recognition/excited ('helm' referencing their previous adventures to get to a nautiloid helm during the tutorial)

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: We remember you well. You saved Us once. Perhaps you can do it again?

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: They are not kind to Us here. We are different, they say. Aberrant.

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: They wish to repurpose Us - destroy what they cannot fix. Please, help Us escape harm!

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: Oh, thank you, thank you! You are a good friend - no, more. Rescuer.

AD_Butcher_Death.speaker: Chop
AD_Butcher_Death.text: Death. Free at last. No more chop, chop, chop...
AD_Butcher_Death.context: NodeContext: Relieved, dying breath, Flicker of lucidity as he's finally freed from mental enslavement.

AD_Butcher_CombatTurn001.speaker: Chop
AD_Butcher_CombatTurn001.text: Head full of red. No want chop. Make it stop. Make me stop.
AD_Butcher_CombatTurn001.context: NodeContext: Anguished moment of lucidity mid-combat, begging the player to free him (kill him) even while possessed to attack.

session_synopses.Butcher_FreedUs: Crime reaction for Chop, the Colony Butcher, after we either free Us from its cage, mess with the cage or kill Us.
session_synopses.AD_Butcher_Idle: Sequential, repeated AD for Chop, the Colony butcher. He will say a line every few seconds while in his idle behaviour. Chop is generally enjoying his job, but something deep beneath his enthralled exterior realizes the horror of his reality. Some of these lines could be considered a little bit song-like - Chop would be humming to himself while working.
session_synopses.Us: Default dialogue with Us while they are in the Colony. Us is either locked in a cage in the Morgue, trying to sneak away from the Butcher, or thanking you for saving them, after which they will disappear.
session_synopses.AD_Butcher_Death: This AD plays when Chop, the Colony Butcher, dies. Chop will fight you because he is enthralled, but has a secret desire to be put out of his misery.
session_synopses.AD_Butcher_CombatTurn001: This AD plays during combat with Chop, the Colony Butcher. Chop will fight you because he is enthralled, but has a secret desire to be put out of his misery.

AD_Butcher_SourcePain.speaker: Chop
AD_Butcher_SourcePain.context: NodeContext: Muted, pained whine - first legible statement from creature

session_synopses.AD_Butcher_SourcePain: This AD plays when Chop, the Colony Butcher, is used as an energy source in one of the Colony's regeneration stations.

PAD_MolEyepatch.speaker: Player
PAD_MolEyepatch.text: This is Mol's eyepatch - what's become of her?

EnterRoom.speaker: Balthazar
EnterRoom.text: How often do I have to repeat myself? No disturbances.
EnterRoom.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar is interrupted from his necromancy by the player's intrusion and turns around to face them with hostilityNodeContext: Irate, distracted

EnterRoom.speaker: Balthazar
EnterRoom.text: Wait - you're no underling of mine. Far too intact for my tastes. That means you're a trespasser.

AD_ZombieErrand.speaker: Balthazar
AD_ZombieErrand.text: Too feeble by far. This needs muscle; the stronger, the better.
AD_ZombieErrand.context: NodeContext: Engrossed in his work, Ordering zombie lackeys about.

session_synopses.PAD_MolEyepatch: The players may come across Mol's discarded eyepatch in the Necromancer Chamber in the Upper Colony. They will react to it appropriately, depending on whether they ever met Mol or not.
session_synopses.EnterRoom: A player walked into Balthazar's chambers in the colony, while Balthazar is alive, and was spotted by him (or one of his undead). Balthazar reacts with hostility, but players can convince him that they have been turned into thralls.This can only happen if Balthazar is alive at this point and you didn't try the Audience with the Absolute. If you did not send Nightsong to Ketheric, Balthazar would have died in combat in her prison.This dialog will also play when interacting with Balthazar in this route.
session_synopses.AD_ZombieErrand: The necromancer is standing over a bowl of blood and bone, conducting a ritual to see the future. He's sending zombies off on errands.
session_synopses.AD_Combat_SendZombie: The necromancer is sending a zombie to light the candles that start an arcane ritual which drains the player's hitpoints and ultimately turns them into a zombie.

Memory_Vault.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault.text: HmmMM... fine bones... sharp jaw... some variety of elf?
Memory_Vault.context: CinematicNodeContext: Working jaw, flitting through expressions as if testing the face out

Memory_Vault.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault.text: Pretty enough for a flesh-prison - if not the noble githzerai features I was born with.

Memory_Vault.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault.text: I'd guess you're no willing guest of the ghaik either. Perhaps we might aid one another.

Memory_Vault.speaker: Player
Memory_Vault.text: You called yourself 'githzerai'. Is that some kind of githyanki?

Memory_Vault.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault.text: Oh, for a set of hands to slap your face. The yanki lost their way the moment Gith threw down the ghaik empire.

Memory_Vault.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_Vault.text: Only we zerai continue the war to end the ghaik forever. Only we fight them their own battlefield - the mind.

session_synopses.Memory_Vault: One of the memories available in the Colony "Brain Reader", found in the Vault.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: So. You did it. Cleared the tower. Killed the villain. Everything you said you'd do.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: NEEDS FLAG: Wulbren is not saved, regardless of player having met him.NodeContext: Slightly verklempt. He's having a nice moment with us but is still grieving his friend.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: We're not out of the woods yet. It seems evil is on its way to Baldur's Gate.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Unfortunately for evil, it has you to worry about. Look after the city - it's an awful place, but it's home.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Wulbren made his life there. For his sake, if nothing else, I'd like to see it survive.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Erm. I... I'll say my goodbyes now. You were - that is, it was... So long.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Barcus is trying to have a heartfelt goodbye with the player but is very awkward.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Good riddance.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Heh. As you say.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Player has said 'good riddance' but Barcus doesn't take it pesonally. He waves goodbye.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Farewell. And good luck.

session_synopses: He's a bit mopey but is very much wanting to stick by Wulbren's side despite being mistreated by him. He doesn't know what's happening next but he knows Wulbren has a plan. So that's something.

NimbleAndNickels.speaker: Nimble
NimbleAndNickels.text: You need to eat before we head off, all right?

NimbleAndNickels.speaker: Nimble
NimbleAndNickels.text: Do you have anything to eat?
NimbleAndNickels.context: NodeContext: suspicious, realising nickles answered too easily

Cerys.speaker: Cerys
Cerys.text: What will we do once we reach the city? No - one problem a time.
Cerys.context: NodeContext: a little stern with herself - she knows it's too easy to catastrophise

Mattis.speaker: Mattis
Mattis.text: Just focus on packing - don't think about Mol.

session_synopses.NimbleAndNickels: Back and forth between nimble and nickels in the tower.
session_synopses.UnfortunateGnome: This occurs in the epilogue. In the top set Wulbren has died and barcus is considering his next steps. In the bottom, Wulbren is alive and barcus is determined to do everything he can to help him.
session_synopses.Cerys: This AD occurs in the epilogue of Act 2. With Zevlor dead, cerys has stepped up to lead the tieflings. She muses about what they need to make it to the city.
session_synopses.Mattis: In the top nodes, the player has shown Mattis mol's eyepatch - implying that she's dead. He's distracted and just trying to focus on packing and getting ready - even though he's worried for Mol. In the bottom, he's eager to go and is scavaging Moonrise for stuff he can sell.
session_synopses.Nickels: Nickels is alive but his friend and caretaker Nimble is dead. He's lost without her and out of sorts.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: When Duke Eltan formed the Flaming Fist, he sought out people of courage and honour to fill its ranks.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: You saved Thaniel, lifted the curse, and killed an immortal.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: It's safe to say, you'd have been recruited in an instant.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Thank you - it would have been an honour to serve under Duke Eltan.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: Of course, I have no idea what life is like under Duke Ravengard's rule.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: But I've seen the respect he inspires in the Flaming Fist - and that tells me all I need about him as a leader.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: I hope you can save Duke Ravengard - for the good of Baldur's Gate.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Come with me - I could use a Flaming Fist by my side.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: Thank you, but look at me - I am a relic: a glimpse of history barely strong enough to stand on his own two feet.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: Besides - Thaniel should have someone here when he wakes up. It's the least I can do.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Then I wish you luck. Thank you for your help.

node_data.speaker: Art Cullagh
node_data.text: You too, my friend. Thank you - from Thaniel and I.

session_synopses: This covers arts three states 1) Thaniel is dead, which means the curse cannot be lifted [he is heartbroken and grieving] 2) the curse quest is in progress, and Thaniel hasn't been saved yet [he's worried for thaniel and frantic] and 3) curse has been lifted and Thaniel is safe [Art is grateful and contemplative, but also a little reserved - he knows he's going to die soon]

node_data.speaker: Mattis
node_data.text: Wish I could've seen you putting Ketheric in his place - must have been quite the spectacle.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Measured admiration; doesn't want the player to think he's too impressed

node_data.speaker: Mattis
node_data.text: Mol would've shanked him up proper.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fond but slightly wistful (Mol is missing)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: So what's the plan now?

node_data.speaker: Mattis
node_data.text: I'm glad you asked! For now, I've got the others scavenging supplies for the road.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Proudly; sees himself as being in charge

node_data.speaker: Mattis
node_data.text: Once they've packed up everything, I'll be leading us all on to Baldur's Gate.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Proudly; sees himself as being in charge

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The others are in good hands - looking forward to seeing you at Baldur's Gate.

node_data.speaker: Mattis
node_data.text: Oh you most definitely will, pal.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Chuffed at the implication he can handle the task

node_data.speaker: Mattis
node_data.text: In fact, I bet we'll even get there first.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Playful

session_synopses: Mattis is quietly worried by Mol's disappearance but is trying to put a brave face on. In the absence of Alfira and Cerys, he is preparing to lead the tieflings to Baldur's Gate himself.

000.speaker: Flaming Fist
000.text: Safely on to Baldur's Gate. For all of us.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: Ah! It's you, isn't it? You're the talk of this place, you know. I'm Isobel, and this is -

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: Ho! But we have met. This is the soldier that freed me most valiantly from the Shadowfell.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: They watched my boot crush the very brain of villainy - and fought well against your changèd father.
node_data.context: NodeContext: old timey change-ed

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: May he rest in peace at last, now that he's dead.
node_data.context: NodeContext: About her father. Tinged with sadness but not too sad. She's about to thank the player warmly.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: I have more to thank you for than I knew. And we have much to discuss. Perhaps we could join you in your camp later?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Firstly, allow me to apologise to Dame Aylin. My actions were strategy - not personal.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: My forgiveness will be the same. I'd be a fool to turn down a powerful ally - especially one who has earned the trust of fair Isobel.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: But Dame Aylin's life is neverending. And she does not forget. Now - I believe Isobel asked a question of you. We will meet you in your camp - is it agreed?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It's a little crowded already.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: We'll make our visit brief. Cleric's honour.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I doubt that. You go your way, and I'll go mine.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: We are not welcome, my love. No matter. We will hie us to the Hill of the Headless Dancer and bare our flesh beneath the cleansing light of the moon's soft gaze.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: A hundred years hasn't changed you at all, my love. As for you - if we aren't to meet again, I'll say my thank-yous. And my goodbyes.
node_data.context: NodeContext: First part to Aylin, Second part to player

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: If we meet again, it will be my pleasure.

session_synopses: If Isobel and Nightsong survive Act 2 they will be having a heartfelt reunion during the Epilogue

PAD_UnfinishedBusiness.speaker: Player
PAD_UnfinishedBusiness.text: The road to Baldur's Gate is up ahead. No turning back, once we start down that road.

session_synopses.PAD_UnfinishedBusiness: After the act 2 epilogue, the party comments on resolving unfinished business before moving on to Baldur's Gate/act 3.

AD_EpilogueIntro.speaker: Withers
AD_EpilogueIntro.text: Against all odds, thou hast survived. Wilt thou reflect with me upon thy triumph?

AD.speaker: Withers
AD.text: Make haste. I would have words with you.
AD.context: NodeContext: Calling for the player's attention

Debrief.speaker: Withers
Debrief.text: The shadows yet fester. The Dead Three, united under cover of darkness. The balance shifts.

Debrief.speaker: Narrator
Debrief.text: *The Dead Three. Myrkul, Bane, and Bhaal - lords of deathly tenets, and traitors to Ao, god of gods.*

Debrief.speaker: Narrator
Debrief.text: *All three sowed chaos at the height of their power. And all three now walk the planes as mortals - or so it's believed.*

Debrief.speaker: Withers
Debrief.text: There are depths to this alliance yet unplumbed. Consider, mortal:

Debrief.speaker: Player
Debrief.text: Forget that. Who are you? What are you doing here?

Debrief.speaker: Withers
Debrief.text: I shall ask yet again. Do illithids possess souls?

session_synopses.AD_EpilogueIntro: Withers AD's on the player successfully defeating Ketheric and coming back to the Epilogue.
session_synopses.AD: Jergal is always present at the epilogue and will try to call for the player's attention. He has important things to say to the player in his debrief about the dead three and what to do next. It will only play before SCE_Jergal_Debrief triggers.
session_synopses.Debrief: Jergal's debrief at MOO after the mind flayer colony.

AD_ArtAndFlamingFist.speaker: Art Cullagh
AD_ArtAndFlamingFist.text: It's... like... like your mind wants you dead.

AD_ArtAndFlamingFist.speaker: Art Cullagh
AD_ArtAndFlamingFist.text: Thaniel. I had to look after him. Without him, I wouldn't have lasted long.

AD_MainGateFlamingFists.speaker: Flaming Fist
AD_MainGateFlamingFists.text: I ought to do the rounds again.

AD_MainGateFlamingFists.speaker: Flaming Fist
AD_MainGateFlamingFists.text: No point. Everyone's wrecked. Leave 'em be.

session_synopses.AD_ArtAndFlamingFist: Art has been cursed for a long time and finally has been freed from the curse. At the epilogue, he will be chatting with another harper about how it felt if he is cured and available.
session_synopses.AD_MainGateFlamingFists: Two flaming fists at the main gate of MOO are guarding it and discussing how finally they will be able to leave the cursed lands and go back to Baldur's Gate, and that they didn't think they would make it.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I found Mol's eyepatch.

node_data.speaker: Ide
node_data.text: This is Mol's... Where did you find it?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Almost accusatory

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Somewhere unpleasant. But I didn't see Mol - she's probably safe somewhere.

node_data.speaker: Ide
node_data.text: 'Course she is! You hang onto that - I bet Mol'll be angry at you for touching her stuff.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Defiant but secretly a little relieved - she's glad the player didn't say Mol was dead

session_synopses: Ide is frustrated by Alfira's attempts to cheer her and the other tiefling kids up - she's more worried about Mol (who is missing).

001.speaker: Nimble
001.text: I can't believe Wulbren's gone. Reviving the Ironhands, returning to Baldur's Gate - it all rested on him.

001.speaker: Nimble
001.text: Gods. What will I tell the others?

session_synopses.001: Eagerly awaiting the next steps from their leader Wulbren. Ready to do whatever he directs. If Wulbren's dead they'll be noticably more downbeat.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: You helped me escape this hellspit, then took down the heart of Moonrise - Ketheric himself. I'm impressed.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: And I'm not a man easily impressed.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Last I saw you, you were disappearing on a boat down the river.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: Not my finest exit. I hid out on the river until the sky lit up. Couldn't believe my eyes - especially when I realised you were behind it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: sincere and impressed

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: I underestimated you. Kept who I was, and who I represent, from you - but I see now that was a mistake.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: I am Wulbren Bongle, leader of the Ironhand Gnomes. No doubt you've heard of us?
node_data.context: NodeContext: said with immense pride

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recall stories of the Ironhand Gnomes - a talented group of inventors who were banished from Baldur's Gate.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I don't know much, I'm afraid.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: We are inventors of the highest order, matched, perhaps, but never surpassed by the Gondians at the High House of Wonders.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: But our forebears were foolish - complicit with Sarevok's madness over a century past, and so we were banished. Still are to this day.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Pity he never succeeded.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: You agree with such machinations? Duly noted.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: I've fought tooth and nail to restore our reputation. Particularly against Gondian detractors who live in glass houses.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: I've filled appeals - pleaded with the High Artificer himself. They've refused us time and again. Now, however, I will make them listen.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Good luck with that.

node_data.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
node_data.text: Our cause is just and righteous, friend. That's all the luck we need.
node_data.context: NodeContext: determined and zealous

session_synopses: This dialogue is peak Wulbren. If he's met you in haven (after you saved him), he rolls back on how rude he was as he realises the player would be an amazing asset in the city. If this is your first time meeting him since the escape (if haven is destroyed he waits out on the river until this scene in the epilogue), he realises how good the player would be to have on his side in the city and tells him all about how wronged the ironhand gnomes were.

Debrief.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Debrief.text: | Ketheric is defeated, but his army marches on. To rid ourselves of this parasite, we will have to give chase. |

session_synopses.Debrief: Minthara is present and gives the debrief to the player after the mindflayer colony.

AD_FlamingSpy_IsobelCombat_001.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_FlamingSpy_IsobelCombat_001.text: General Ketheric wants her alive - at any cost!

PAD_SpottedWrit.speaker: Player
PAD_SpottedWrit.text: What's that sticking out of his pocket?

session_synopses.PAD_SpottedWrit: Observation on spotting the writ in Art Cullagh's pants. This is needed to direct the player to the House of Healing, which is where they will find his lute.

OutOfPosition.speaker: Jaheira
OutOfPosition.text: Bear with me for a moment, there are better places to talk.

AD_CombatTaunts.speaker: Jaheira
AD_CombatTaunts.text: Serene she might seem, but nature has fangs!

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: The Archdruid Halsin. Do not be surprised that I know your name - you fit a rather singular description.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: And one survivor of the shadow curse's fall ought to know another.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Player
MeetsHalsin.text: No one who witnessed that battle is likely to forget it.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: Not the battle, nor what came after.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: Those of us who saw the birth of the shadow curse seem doomed to return, and bear witness to its work again.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: But I ought to warn you, Halsin. Much as it shames me - it is not the curse I come to cleanse, but the cult.

AD_AtCheckpoint.speaker: Jaheira
AD_AtCheckpoint.text: If you see movement, don't be too quick to shoot. Friend and foe look alike in the deep shadows.
AD_AtCheckpoint.context: NodeContext: speaking to and encouraging allies who are watching a defensive perimiter - on edge

AD_PlayersAttackJaheira.speaker: Jaheira
AD_PlayersAttackJaheira.text: Harpers, to me! We have a True Soul to crush.

session_synopses.MeetsHalsin: Halsin and Jaheira conversation to catch them not being a true soul like she's looking for. Instead they have a civil conversation, but bearly do more than scratch the surface
session_synopses.AD_AtCheckpoint: Jaheira is waiting for the return of her scouts. On edge.
session_synopses.AD_PlayersAttackJaheira: Jaheira calls all of the Harpers in the Haven to fight if you choose to attack them as part of the Entering Haven situation

node_data.speaker: Ox
node_data.text: Something seems different. I don't know what. But I do know it's something.

session_synopses: The player talks to an Ox. This is the same creature as S_DEN_Mule_002, Fenella Fudge

AD_OutsideSignPost.speaker: Narrator
AD_OutsideSignPost.text: *For a warm bed and full stomach, look no further. Welcome to the Last Light Inn.*
AD_OutsideSignPost.context: NodeContext: a sign for an inn

session_synopses.AD_OutsideSignPost: This signpost is located just outside of the last ligh inn.

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: Glad you and Karlach are all right. Well - as all right as any of us.

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: A makeshift Harper's fire might not be where I hoped to set up shop, but maybe I've got something you can use anyway.

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: And if you find any interesting materials in need of working, I'm happy to help.
Weaponsmith.context: NodeContext: Said with a slightly knowing tone

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: I... hesitated to mention this back in the druids' grove - for obvious reasons - but no one has earned my trust if not you.

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: When Elturel was dragged into Avernus, I was drafted into a devil's smithy. It should have been awful, but infernal metal is like a wild horse. Powerful, exuberant - it'll kill you if you lack technique.

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: I can sense some, smell it almost, somewhere in the area. Underground, maybe - out there, in the shadows.

Weaponsmith.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith.text: If you find it, bring it to me. I'll make something incredible.

Mirkon.speaker: Mirkon
Mirkon.text: Once Ketheric is gone, we can get out of here. I can't wait.
Mirkon.context: InternalNodeContext: Nightsong arrived to Haven/dead, people know that Ketheric can be killedNodeContext: This is the first bit of hope you've felt in a while. Thinking of the outside and travelling without fear

Mattis.speaker: Mattis
Mattis.text: I can't wait to get outta this dump and never come back. Grab what you can before we scarper, yeah?
Mattis.context: NodeContext: Sigh at the beginning fo the sentence. Excited ot get out. Sick of the place.

Mattis.speaker: Mattis
Mattis.text: Check it out - we've gone legitimate, and Mol put me in charge. Whaddya need?

Mattis.speaker: Player
Mattis.text: You got any stock for an extra special customer like me?

Mattis.speaker: Mattis
Mattis.text: Hmm. I'm not supposed to mention it to anyone, but I do have something pretty special in stock. A key.

Mattis.speaker: Mattis
Mattis.text: What does it look like? What does it open? What treasures await behind its lock? That's for one lucky buyer to find out.

Mattis.speaker: Mattis
Mattis.text: Mol gave it to me, said I shouldn't let it go to just any old jack-a-day.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.text: Yeah, 'cause she did a great job protecting Mol.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.speaker: Mattis
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.text: Maybe we should ask someone else?
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.context: NodeContext: kind of coming around to umi's thinking

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.text: Who? No one cares - no one but us.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.context: NodeContext: determined - feeling like she's on her own

session_synopses.AD_Mattis: AD for Mattis, a cheeky Dodger type character selling trinkets in the Last Light Inn. Mattis is shouting out, trying to draw customers in.
session_synopses.Weaponsmith: This is the Haven state and dialogue for Dammon if he is rescued and brought back to the inn. He can be traded with in certain states and can forge a weapon of hellish power if the player brings him the right material.
session_synopses.Mirkon: Mirkon is the boy who survived the Harpies trying to lull him into the water in the grove. He is a timid boy who does his best to be brave, and dreams of being an adventurer one day. This is his dialogue in Haven, which covers the main states of the kidnapping, losing Isobel, reporting that his fellow tieflings died, when the player returns them and so on.
session_synopses.Mattis: Dialog with Mattis in Haven. He's a young tiefling boy who dreams of opening up his own shop in baldur's gate. He's delighted to be given the responsibility of the 'shop' in the Last Light Inn and does his best to sound more 'grown-up' and 'formal'. But he fumbles it a bit.This is his main dialogue in Haven and covers all major states, Isobel and Mol kidnapped, the Inn attacked, tieflings dead, etc.
session_synopses.KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD: Umi, Mattis and Ide are discussing a plan to rescue their friend Mol from Moonrise.

StuffedBear.speaker: Player
StuffedBear.text: Is that Darkmaw the Wicked? I don't believe it.
StuffedBear.context: InternalNodeContext: Nature skill check succeeded.NodeContext: looking at a stuffed bear statue, it's huge. You recognise it.

StuffedBear.speaker: Player
StuffedBear.text: His territory ran from the Wood of Sharp Teeth to Cloakwood. It took half an army to drive him out. How did he end up here?
StuffedBear.context: NodeContext: looking at a stuffed bear statue, it's huge

session_synopses.StuffedBear: This is Darkmaw the Wicked. He is a huge stuffed bear right by the entrance to Last Light. If the player passes a nature check, they recall the story of Darkmaw, and wonder how he ended up in a tavern, of all places.

Reunited.speaker: Bex
Reunited.text: You're all right. My gods, you're all right!
Reunited.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danis and Bex facing each other

Reunited.speaker: Danis
Reunited.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danis and Bex embrace completely. They are so fckn happy to be reunited after Danis was taken to MOO. They end their hug and gaze into each others' eyes at the end of the node

Reunited.speaker: Player
Reunited.text: A beautiful sight, and all thanks to me.

Reunited.speaker: Danis
Reunited.text: Credit where it's due - Bex, this is the one who helped me and the others escape.
Reunited.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Credit where it's due" turns to player
"Bex' - Danis places hand on Bex's shoulder and looks at her
"This is the one who helped me" alternates between player and Bex to make introductionsNodeContext: With a chuckle, super happy and amused by the player even though player's being a prick

Reunited.speaker: Bex
Reunited.text: This isn't the first time you've helped us - saved our lives, really. Why?
Reunited.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bex breaks away and steps toward player, looks at them closely.

Reunited.speaker: Bex
Reunited.context: NodeContext: With a smile, accepting the player's remote reason for helping them. She's sincere and grateful.

Reunited.speaker: Danis
Reunited.text: Thanks aren't enough, but we'll give them anyway. Every day, for the rest of our very long lives.
Reunited.context: NodeContext: With a twinkle in his eye. He's grateful to the player.

Danis.speaker: Danis
Danis.text: Bex isn't easily offended, so gods know what you said to upset her so much.
Danis.context: NodeContext: If the player really offended Bex earlier, Danis reacts. He's still grateful to the player, but wary now.

Danis.speaker: Danis
Danis.text: After everything you've done for us, she'll come around eventually, I'm sure.

session_synopses.Reunited: Danis and Bex are reunited in the Last Light Inn after the player has saved Danis from being trapped in MOO. The two are ecstatic to see one another for the first time in a long time and very grateful to the player.
session_synopses.Danis: Danis' dialog in Haven after his rescue.He has made it safely to Haven after escaping Moonrise Towers and has been reunited with Bex, his partner, if she's alive, or is alone if she's not. If she's alive, the player witnessed a really cute reunion between them, and these dialogues cover Danis' followups to that conversation, as well as versions for if he's alone and for a few states in Haven. Not all states are covered since Danis doesn't care much about Ketheric

node_data.speaker: Phasm
node_data.text: Hm. No. Still incapable.

node_data.speaker: Phasm
node_data.text: Hm. No. Incapable.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Incapable of what?

node_data.speaker: Phasm
node_data.text: Not for you to know.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're a rare breed. An authentic Red-Backed River Ox. I thought you'd be more discerning...
True

node_data.speaker: Phasm
node_data.text: Well...

node_data.speaker: Phasm
node_data.text: Come close. Your mind to mine.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ox and player lean close, foreheads close but not touching.

node_data.text: CinematicNodeContext: | Show a spliced together horror clip of spooky and/or gross images - this will be handled by a bespoke movie)
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: | Show a spliced together horror clip of spooky and/or gross images - this will be handled by a bespoke movie)

node_data.speaker: Phasm
node_data.text: Are you satisfied?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: How does an ox like yourself have such horrifying thoughts?

node_data.speaker: Phasm
node_data.text: It's a talent.

node_data.speaker: Phasm
node_data.text: My little secret.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What are you really?

node_data.speaker: Phasm
node_data.text: Keep quiet, and you won't have to find out.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Whatever you are, you're coming out of hiding. Now.

node_data.speaker: Phasm
node_data.text: All I wanted was a bit of hay, a good brushing, and a clean stall. The simple life. IS THAT SO MUCH TO ASK?!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Escalating to fury and prepping to transform into evil creature and fight player.

session_synopses: This Ox is a fiendish creature in an ox's body. The ox will show the player a horrific vision from its mind, and potentially go aggro on the player if the player demands answers from it. The ox could also give a gift if the player is evil, like it.

session_synopses.ARENA_Wave0: Arena Cam for Halsins Lakeside Combat for Wave 0 of enemies spawning
session_synopses.ARENA_Wave1: Arena Cam for Halsins Lakeside Combat for Wave 1 of enemies spawning
session_synopses.ARENA_Wave2: Arena Cam for Halsins Lakeside Combat for Wave 2 of enemies spawning

AD_AngryBrother.speaker: Cal
AD_AngryBrother.text: Rolan's right - I should have done more, I should have saved you.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: ...There's another bottle of Arabellan Dry back there. Put it on the bar, then piss off and leave me alone.
Rolan.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at UmiNodeContext: Slurring slightly, a little bit drunk and irritable - talking to Ide, a tiefling child behind the bar

Rolan.speaker: Ide
Rolan.text: Jaheira said we should serve drinks, but that we shouldn't serve drunks.
Rolan.context: NodeContext: cheerful, playing the part of a bartender - it's a game to him and this is a line he's learned

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Jaheira didn't save your ragged little tail from the cultists - I did.
Rolan.context: NodeContext: venemous - bitter, addressed to Umi

Rolan.speaker: Player
Rolan.text: You saved the kid? Sounds like you deserve a drink.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Oh, it's you. I'd recognise that self-righteous tone anywhere.
Rolan.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after noticing them, and sneers at them

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: If you're here to save the day again, you're a little late this time.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Oh, sod off. I'm only here because you 'helped' me and my family.
Rolan.context: NodeContext: Heavy sarcasm on 'helped' - not quite doing airquotes but that's the tone

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: I was ready to cut and run back at the grove, but you had other ideas.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Cal and Lia were taken in by your crap. You convinced them to play hero, and now they're gone.

Rolan.speaker: Player
Rolan.text: Do you know where they are?

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Dead for all I know. Or in the cult's tower with the others who were taken.

Rolan.speaker: Player
Rolan.text: They're better off dead than in the cult's hands.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: Bullshit. If they're alive, I can save them.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: You go save the world, or your own arse, or whatever it is you do. I'll fix this.
Rolan.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns away, back to the bar when he's done talking

Hologram.text: Lia, Cal, if you see this... I'm dead. It's nothing to get upset about - it's simply the way life is.
Hologram.context: NodeContext: voice thick with emotion at the thought of never seeing his siblings again, but he's trying to be no nonsense. Doesn't want them to grieve.

Hologram.text: Head to Baldur's Gate immediately. You'll both do excellently there, I have no doubt. And thank you for, well, you know.
Hologram.context: NodeContext: voice thick with emotion at the thought of never seeing his siblings again, but he's trying to be no nonsense. Doesn't want them to grieve.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: If this is about Rolan, go away.
Ide.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking away from player, avoiding eye contactNodeContext: Upset frustrated

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: No need to snap at me.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: ...Sorry. Rolan snapped too and I didn't like it.

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: Rolan isn't very good with kids.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: He isn't very good with anyone. He yelled at me just because I told him not to drink anymore.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: It was for his own good! He can barely stand up straight.
Ide.context: NodeContext: your voice could be mistake for petulance but you're just hurt and frustrated.

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: I get it - you were trying to look after him.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Yeah. He did save us, after all.
Ide.context: NodeContext: Kind of awkward and bashful about it

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: What do you mean, his loss?

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: I found this book. Old, dusty, full of strange lettering. Pretty sure it's magic.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: I was gonna give it to Rolan so he could learn new spells, you know? Beats drinking 'til he forgets the ones he knows.
Ide.context: NodeContext: a little downcast - you were trying to make a gesture and you feel it's been trodden on

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: If you give it to me, I'll make sure he gets it.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Fine. Here, you ... huh, where is it?
Ide.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reaching behind back for the book to find it missing. Looking around - confused. NodeContext: You can't find the book on your person. You're looking around confused.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: I musta dropped it. Well, you can look for it if you want.
Ide.context: NodeContext: Nonchalant - it's not your problem.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Anyway, I'm sick of talking. You can go now. Bye-bye.
Ide.context: NodeContext: Shrug and nonchalant as you end the convo

AD_BeforeReunion.speaker: Lia
AD_BeforeReunion.text: Gods, you smell like a brewery.

AD_BeforeReunion.speaker: Rolan
AD_BeforeReunion.text: What does that have to do with anything?
AD_BeforeReunion.context: NodeContext: pissed off, doesn't like anyone being worried about him

AD_BeforeReunion.speaker: Lia
AD_BeforeReunion.text: You're enough of an arse when you're sober, never mind drunk.
AD_BeforeReunion.context: NodeContext: knows she's adding fuel to the fire but is too mad not to

AD_BeforeReunion.speaker: Rolan
AD_BeforeReunion.text: Oh, don't get all high and mighty with me, Lia.

AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.speaker: Cal
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.text: How am I going to tell him about Lia?
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.context: NodeContext: grieving, wondering how rolan will react

AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.speaker: Cal
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.text: 'We escaped Moonrise, but things went wrong?'
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.context: NodeContext: trying to practice what to say to rolan, awkward and hesitant

AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.speaker: Cal
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.text: 'Lia didn't make it...' Gods, it doesn't sound real.
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.context: NodeContext: grief that his sister is dead hitting him

AD_SiblingsReturn.speaker: Cal
AD_SiblingsReturn.context: NodeContext: relief as he sees his siblings just ahead of him

AD_SiblingsReturn.speaker: Rolan
AD_SiblingsReturn.text: Cal! Wretched gods, where have you been? Where's Lia?

AD_SiblingsReturn.speaker: Rolan
AD_SiblingsReturn.text: Cal, answer me. Where is Lia?
AD_SiblingsReturn.context: NodeContext: worried and concern. sees the look on siblings face andfears the worst

AD_RolanAndKid.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanAndKid.text: Your job is to serve drinks, you little devil. Do it.
AD_RolanAndKid.context: NodeContext: absolutely hammered drunk and belligerent

AD_RolanAndKid.speaker: Umi
AD_RolanAndKid.context: NodeContext: small voice, trying to stand up to an adult

AD_RolanAndKid.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanAndKid.context: NodeContext: absolutely hammered drunk and belligerent, LOUD

Umi.speaker: Umi
Umi.text: The sky looks so pretty with the light. Whoever it is must be good - they must be.

Reunion.speaker: Rolan
Reunion.text: Where in the Nine Hells have you been?
Reunion.context: NodeContext: frustrated and accusatory - rolan was worried sick but instead of showing it he is being a dick

Reunion.speaker: Lia
Reunion.text: I'm sorry we got captured by murderous lunatics.
Reunion.context: NodeContext: rolan has spoken sharply to her and her temper flares in response - snarky and frustrated

Reunion.speaker: Rolan
Reunion.text: I thought you were dead, you ass. Both of you!
Reunion.context: NodeContext: frustration tinged with upset - getting emotional

Reunion.speaker: Cal
Reunion.text: We're all safe, Rolan - that's what matters.

Reunion.speaker: Rolan
Reunion.text: The beggar wants their coppers, do they? Fine by me.
Reunion.context: NodeContext: being an asshole to the player, snarky and mean

Reunion.speaker: Cal
Reunion.text: Rolan, we're alive because of them - don't be like that.
Reunion.context: NodeContext: nervous, trying to dispel the situation.

Reunion.speaker: Rolan
Reunion.text: Here - take this and leave. You can go now.

PAD_HologramReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_HologramReaction.text: He'll need help to survive those shadows. Only a fool would face them alone.

session_synopses.AD_AngryBrother: Lia died in Moonrise. Upon his return to Last Light, Cal and Rolan had a massive argument that the player failed to dispel. Cal, upset, walked away from Rolan and now stands on the balcony. He's upset, grieving, and wishing he had died instead of his sister.
session_synopses.Rolan: Rolan is an apprentice wizard whose siblings were recently captured by cultists. He's stuck in a tavern in the middle of the cursed lands where they were taken, drinking heavily, blaming himself for their loss. When he sees the players, he turns his frustration onto them - he's only here because they convinced him to stay with the other tieflings who were captured in the first place.Rolan is in fact the only reason any of the tieflings are still alive, having protected them from the traitorous Zevlor, who planned to give them over to the cult. He doesn't feel like a hero though - he feels like a failure.
session_synopses.Hologram: Rolan has left a message behind in Haven, for his siblings. This is a small automated hologram that is fixed to the bar counter. It plays a message (that he's gone looking for his siblings or that he's dead) when the player interacts with it.
session_synopses.Ide: Ide mainly talks about the interaction the player can have with Rolan in his dialog (HAV_ProdigyLament_Rolan), where he berates the kid for not giving him more alcohol. This dialog continues that narrative beat, and players can acquire a book Ide was planning to give Rolan.
session_synopses.AD_BeforeReunion: This AD covers the following scenarios: Lia alive, Cal dead. Cal alive, Lia dead. Cal, Lia and Rolan all alive and well. This AD occurs after the player has rescued Cal and/ or Lia from Moonrise towers, but BEFORE the player triggers the reunion scene in Last Light. The siblings are standing together and arguing.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherWaitingAlone: Cal has been rescued from Moonrise towers prison by the player and is now in Last Light Inn. His sister Lia is dead and his brother Rolan is nowhere to be found (but he left a message telling Cal to wait for his return). Cal is talking to himself here. He's nervous, scared for Rolan and grieving Lia.
session_synopses.AD_SiblingsReturn: A one off AD that occurs when Lia and/or Cal spot Rolan upon entering Last Light after being rescued from Moonrise.
session_synopses.AD_RolanAndKid: Roland and Umi are standing at the bar. Umi is behind the bar and Roland is badgering Umi to serve him more alcohol. Roland is extremely drunk and belligerent, and Umi is trying to calm him down.
session_synopses.Umi: Umi is young boy in the Haven. He spends most of his time hunting for valuable items in the Inn. He really looks up to the boss of his crew, Mol. This dialogue covers all his main states in Haven, including isobel and mol's kidnapping, when haven is left unprotected, when it's being attacked etc.
session_synopses.Reunion: Cal and/or Lia have been rescued from Moonrise towers and reunited with Rolan in Last Light Inn. It is initially a tense scene - Rolan was worried sick/is angry one of his siblings is dead and is taking it out on his family. It is up to the player to calm them down and remind them of what is important - family.
session_synopses.PAD_HologramReaction: PAD for after players see Rolan's hologram in the Last Light Inn for the first time. They comment on needing to go save Rolan as he won't be able to shadow creatures on his own.

AD_LoverInspection.speaker: Danis
AD_LoverInspection.text: We have to worry about parasites now? Gods.

AD_BrotherInspection.speaker: Danis
AD_BrotherInspection.text: I would tell you if I had one, I swear it!

AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.speaker: Manip Vidor
AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.text: J'ehlar is doing her best, but he shows no signs of waking.

AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.text: If you have an alternative in mind, please do propose it.

AD_WulbrenInspection.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_WulbrenInspection.text: This is ridiculous - as if I'd let some parasite infect me.
AD_WulbrenInspection.context: NodeContext: Loathing in his voice at the thought

FlirtyTiefling.speaker: Lakrissa
FlirtyTiefling.text: The light - it's happening. Ketheric is about to get a long overdue arse-kicking - I can feel it.

AD_SisterInspection.speaker: Lia
AD_SisterInspection.text: Can we hurry this up? I need a drink. Now.
AD_SisterInspection.context: NodeContext: annoyed and a little nervous

FlamingFist_001.speaker: Fist Thadwick
FlamingFist_001.text: This is no place for amateurs.
FlamingFist_001.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: now annoyed that player is talking again

FlamingFist_002.speaker: Fist Aubree
FlamingFist_002.text: I've heard the stories about Moonrise. I hope the Duke is all right.
FlamingFist_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: <GL> reshoot, last version had almost no movementInternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: concerned

FlamingFist_003.speaker: Fist Rahir
FlamingFist_003.text: Nothing to be done here. The Duke's in the Towers.
FlamingFist_003.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: strict but coming from a good place

Arrival.speaker: Narrator
Arrival.text: *You drift through the dark until time, skill, or luck brings you to Last Light's dock.*
Arrival.context: CinematicNodeContext: Screen is black. As the narration ends, it fades up to reveal players and prisoners standing on the dock with the Harper walking towards them

Arrival.speaker: Harper Arthus
Arrival.text: Hold there! You can't just land and start unloading strangers - there are procedures, damn it.

Arrival.speaker: Harper Arthus
Arrival.text: No one gets in without being tested - Commander Jaheira's orders.

Arrival.speaker: Player
Arrival.text: We just escaped the Absolute - these people need sanctuary, not 'procedures'.

Arrival.speaker: Harper Arthus
Arrival.text: And they'll have it, once we know they're free from infection.

AD_Gnome02Inspection.speaker: Nickels
AD_Gnome02Inspection.text: I want to go inside - to the wood and stone. Where it's quiet - safe.

AD_Gnome01Inspection.speaker: Nimble
AD_Gnome01Inspection.text: This is a waste of time - I certainly don't have one.

Manip.speaker: Manip Vidor
Manip.text: Heard you're meant to be heading toward the Towers.

Manip.speaker: Manip Vidor
Manip.text: With a single word, Florrick could charge the Coast's most powerful force with taking back the Grand Duke.

Manip.speaker: Manip Vidor
Manip.text: We ought to be doing just that. Not babysitting this stump.
Manip.context: NodeContext: bitter edge in his voice

AD_FlamingFist_003_InCombat.speaker: Fist Rahir
AD_FlamingFist_003_InCombat.context: NodeContext: battle cry - determined and unafraid despite being outnumbered

ArrivalInspector.speaker: Harper Arthus
ArrivalInspector.text: Keep your distance. Let's not confuse the parasite.

session_synopses.AD_LoverInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.AD_ArguingWithFlorrick: Florrick and Vidor are talking between themselves about how to proceed. Florrick wants to wait until Mart Cullagh is awake and can tell them more about the shadowcurse. Vidor wants to plan an attack on Moonrise Towers to rescue Grand Duke Ravengard. They aren't at cross purposes, but they don't agree on much.
session_synopses.AD_WulbrenInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlirtyTiefling: Lakrissa's dialogue after her reunion scene with alfira (or potentially this is her only scene if alfira is dead). Lakrissa is usually playful and flirty but she is a but more restrained here. Still smiling but more somber.
session_synopses.AD_SisterInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_001: Thadwick is a male dwarf and grumpy is his middle name. He's a bit rough and gruff and has little time for the player - an amateur in his eyes. He warms up to him slightly as we progress through the dialogue. This dialogue cover his major states in Haven.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_002: Flaming Fist Aubree is devoted to the Ravengard but also pragmatic. She's unafraid of asking for the player's help and is concerned for Ravengard. Does her best to look at things in a non-judgemental way.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_003: Flaming Fist Rahir is a stern solider who admires Duke Ravengard. He is tough and nonense.
session_synopses.Arrival: Standing on a dock, the Player's just arrived back in Haven after escaping Moonrise Towers with a boat of prisoners seeking sanctuary. A surprised Harper greets you and says he'll need to test the new arrivals.
session_synopses.AD_Gnome02Inspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.AD_Gnome01Inspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.Manip: The Flaming FIst Manip, Vidor, has conflict with Florrick prior to any of these dialogues. He is the sergeant of the FF troops, and believes Florrick is a terrible leader. Player can respond to his idea that he should attack Moonrise.
session_synopses.ArrivalInspector: The Harper Inspecter is either looking over a batch of prisoners who've just arrived in Moonrise or has just finished inspecting them and is walking away when the player intercepts him. A gruff and suspicious guard.

PAD_Moonshield.speaker: Player
PAD_Moonshield.text: No shadows here - something must be keeping it at bay.

session_synopses.PAD_Moonshield: VB played on the first time the players reach the Moonshield on the Haven bridge. They comment on how it holding back the shodows.

PAD_HalsinDeath.speaker: Player
PAD_HalsinDeath.text: Halsin... he's dead. No chance of lifting the curse now.

PortalEntry.speaker: Halsin
PortalEntry.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player tries to enter the portal, the portal rejects the player before closing.NodeContext: Sudden alarm

PortalEntry.speaker: Halsin
PortalEntry.text: It's gone... that was our one chance. You've doomed this place to darkness!
PortalEntry.context: NodeContext: Shock gives way to a furious outburst.

PortalEntry.speaker: Halsin
PortalEntry.text: I warned you - told you this was my burden to carry. Why didn't you listen?
PortalEntry.context: NodeContext: Anger cools back down to sorrow and disappointment.

PortalEntry.speaker: Player
PortalEntry.text: I'm sorry - I acted on instinct.

PortalEntry.speaker: Halsin
PortalEntry.text: Words won't repair what's been done to this land. Nothing will... I need to be alone.
PortalEntry.context: CinematicNodeContext: walks away after delivering the line, dejectedNodeContext: dejected

session_synopses.PAD_HalsinDeath: Player reacts to Halsin being killed by shadows while he'd been trying to open a portal to the Shadowfell.
session_synopses.PortalEntry: Halsin has been conducting a ritual to open a portal to the Shadowfell while the player defends him from attacking shadows. In this case, the player interfered with the portal (trying to enter it themselves) causing it to collapse. Halsin reacts, aghast. His one chance to infiltrate the Shadowfell and lift the shadow curse has been lost. He expresses his anger to the player and walks off. Ultimately he will part ways from us for good sometime soon after.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: You actually did it - you rescued them from Moonrise. How?
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: full of gratitude

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: By doing what I do best - being a hero.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: If it was anyone else, I'd be sceptical - but you? You've more than earned the title of hero.
Bard.context: NodeContext: grateful and a little flirty

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: By the time we get to the city, I'm gonna have an entire catalogue of songs about you.
Bard.context: NodeContext: grateful and a little flirty

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: It's not much, but here - you deserve it.

AD_WithFlirty.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_WithFlirty.text: Anything happen while I was away?
AD_WithFlirty.context: NodeContext: trying to make convo but she's actually worried for alfira

AD_WithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
AD_WithFlirty.text: Too much. I can't wait for things to just be... quiet.
AD_WithFlirty.context: NodeContext: little bit tired and down but trying not to sound it.

AD_WithFlirty.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_WithFlirty.text: It'll be quiet in the city. We'll have a little house, maybe a garden?
AD_WithFlirty.context: NodeContext: sincere and heartfelt - trying to make alfira smile

session_synopses.Bard: Alfira has seen her friends, people she considered family, dragged screaming into the nigh. She is upset and only just holding it together. She asks the player to save the prisoners in Moonrise.
session_synopses.AD_WithFlirty: This occurs after alfira and lakrissa have their reunion scene in last light (player has rescued lakrissa from moonrise). Lakrissa and Alfira are being cute and concenered for each other.

PAD_SecondInsight.speaker: Player
PAD_SecondInsight.text: Looks like that odd ox made it through the shadows.

session_synopses.PAD_SecondInsight: The player walks past the stables outside the inn and can determine this is the same ox they saw in Druid's Grove if they pass an insight check

DismissesHalsin.speaker: Narrator
DismissesHalsin.text: *The Flaming Fist looks past your shoulder; it seems he'd prefer not to speak to you.*

session_synopses.DismissesHalsin: Narrator line for the situation where Halsin tries to talk to Marcus while marcus is waiting to talk to a True Soul

AD_Arrival_Harper_000.speaker: Harper Lassandra
AD_Arrival_Harper_000.text: Yonas should be here with us.
AD_Arrival_Harper_000.context: NodeContext: Yonas died recently on a mission

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: He was joking, this morning. Yonas, I mean.
Harper_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks up to stand behind Meygan, but she doesn't look at them.InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet.

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
