Harper_001.text: There was an ambush in the dark. The shadows dragged him away...

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: He was always joking. Said it was good for morale, but he just liked seeing people laugh.
Harper_001.context: NodeContext: Small pause before the line.

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: He was a good Harper. A good friend...
Harper_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after finishing this line

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: I thought we could have been something more, one day, but...
Harper_001.context: NodeContext: Chokes up a little. Swallows back her tears.

Harper_001.speaker: Player
Harper_001.text: I'm sure he knew. I'm sure he cared for you as well.

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: I don't know. And I never will.

Harper_001.speaker: Harper Meygan
Harper_001.text: I'm sorry, I'd like to be alone.

session_synopses.AD_Arrival_Harper_000: Single-fire AD when LAssandra lands back at Haven after the scene where her contingent is attacked by shadow creatures. She is relieved to be back but heavy-hearted cause one of her own was lost.
session_synopses.Harper_001: Dialogue with Meygan in Last Light. She is standing before an altar, mourning Yonas' death. She might give us something if we give her his sword. Despite changes in the state of the grove, she usually reverts to her normal dialogue/ state of sadness as she was close to Yonas and that's more to the front of her mind than stuff like Ketheric

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: On with you. Unless you want to come back to a gaggle of shadow-cursed Harpers.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: My blood... it's telling me to kill you.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: And yet you hesitate.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Suspicious, hardened voice

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *She doesn't believe you will do it. You can see, she wants to believe there is mercy in all, even in the worst.*

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: You aren't the first to threaten me. But I know the eyes of a killer when I see them. You mean me no harm. Do you? An experienced cleric can tell such things.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The Urge within does not want to talk. The restless Urge starts to scream.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Chase away your putrid desires.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As suddenly as it started, you have tamed the Urge. It slumbers again.*

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: There we are. The real you. Your - affliction, is it? - doesn't rule you, does it.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm cursed with spells of madness, forgive me what I said.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: Let things begin again, as long as you keep the peace in Last Light.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

DismissesHalsin.speaker: Isobel
DismissesHalsin.text: You're not the True Soul I'm looking for, sorry to say.

session_synopses: Isobel's default dialog in HAV. Varies greatly depending on the state of HAV and what the player has discovered in Moonrise or Shar Temple.
session_synopses.DismissesHalsin: If Halsin is recruited early he can approach Isobel to talk, but she will one-liner dismiss him.

002.speaker: Harper Bor
002.context: NodeContext: nervous, but hope is returning

session_synopses.002: Bor is a grizzled Harper veteran who treats all twists of fate with the same cheerful resignation.

AD_Jahiera.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Jahiera.text: Strike like lightning! Roar like thunder! Wash over them with a blizzard's fury!

session_synopses.AD_Jahiera: Part of Jaheira behaviour during Siege in the basement. Walks among the harpers and cheers them during battle. Martial. in command. Powerful.

AD_Combat_HarperQuartermaster.speaker: Quartermaster Talli
AD_Combat_HarperQuartermaster.text: Get back in the trash pile where you belong!

AD_Combat_DockGuard_Melee_JaheiraDied.speaker: Harper Hangfar
AD_Combat_DockGuard_Melee_JaheiraDied.text: This is for what you did to Jaheira!

DouseTorch.speaker: Narrator
DouseTorch.text: *The denizens of Last Light are fed up with your reckless torch-dousing in the face of the shadow curse.*

session_synopses.DouseTorch: Darkness causes death in SCL. As such, Haven npcs consider dousing torches as a crime. This crime has one warning.

AD_GnomeAndCat.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_GnomeAndCat.text: I'll be out of your way as soon as I'm finished...

AD_ReturnedPrisoners.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners.text: First things first, we have to make it to the city.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners.context: NodeContext: trying to calm her friend down, in full big sister/caring mode

AD_ReturnedPrisoners.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners.text: Wulbren can't come with us - it's just you and me now.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners.context: NodeContext: her leader is dead and she has to hold her own grief in while trying to calm nickels down

session_synopses.AD_GnomeAndCat: Overhead text of Barcus Wroot casually interacting with His Majesty, the local cat.
session_synopses.AD_ReturnedPrisoners: These ADs occur after the gnomes are rescued by the player from Moonrise jail. They occur in Haven. The gnomes are trying to figure out what to do. Their varations include: Wulbren, Nimble and Nickels alive, Wulbren and Nimble alive, Wulbren and Nickels alive, Nickels and Nimble alive.

JaheiraCallToArm.speaker: Jaheira
JaheiraCallToArm.text: To arms! Protect Isobel at all cost!
JaheiraCallToArm.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus should be on the shoulders up to obscure whether or not Jaheira has a weapon in hand (cannot be guaranteed).NodeContext: Shouted during the onset of battle

PAD_SpyTransformationClue.speaker: Player

IsobelSaved.speaker: Isobel
IsobelSaved.context: NodeContext: Doubled over coughing but telling player not to worry about her.

AD_BeforeFlamingSpy.speaker: Isobel
AD_BeforeFlamingSpy.context: NodeContext: In a trance, melodic-sounding prayer. Edge case if the player clicks on her while she's in prayer.

AD_CombatBetrayalReveal.speaker: Isobel

AD_CombatBetrayalReveal.context: NodeContext: Fury in her voice, called out during combat

FlamingSpy_Dead.speaker: Fist Marcus
FlamingSpy_Dead.text: Marcus Falgor... raised in... Baldur's Gate...

FollowUpSaved.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved.context: InternalNodeContext: To IsobelNodeContext: Relieved. If Isobel had been taken, things would be very bad

FollowUpSaved.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved.context: NodeContext: Reassuring - Isobel's survival means the survival of the entire region, so she's saying 'I'm all good, let's worry about more important things'

FollowUpSaved.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved.text: Marcus has been with us since the start - they've been tracking us this whole time.

FollowUpSaved.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved.text: And that was no random attack - you were the target, Isobel. They know how important you are.

FollowUpSaved.speaker: Jaheira
FollowUpSaved.text: But they don't know about you.
FollowUpSaved.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to playerInternalNodeContext: To player

FollowUpSaved.speaker: Isobel
FollowUpSaved.text: The True Soul who saved my life.

session_synopses.JaheiraCallToArm: Isobel is being attacked. Jaheira calls people to defend Isobel, as their lives depend on her.This dialog can happen anywhere in Last Light, but mainly close to Isobel's room.
session_synopses.PAD_SpyTransformationClue: If we go up on the roof above Isobel’s room, we’ll find discarded FF armour and some bloodstains from a transformation of some kind. A successful med check shows someone burst out of their armour (Marcus)
session_synopses.IsobelSaved: Once the Flaming Fist has been defeated, a shaken Isobel urges players who helped her to go and assist with the fight in the main room. She is coughing and unwell.
session_synopses.AD_BeforeFlamingSpy: The player clicks on Isobel before her dialogue with the Flaming Fist spy has been resolved, i.e. it wasn't started, or it was started and interrupted.
session_synopses.Jaheira_AD_ToIsobel: Jaheira is trying to get to Isobel after the area has been attacked by winged ghouls.
session_synopses.BriefInRoom: Isobel is in her room re-casting the spell that is protecting the inn. After she spots you, she gives you information about Ketheric and a spell to protect you from the shadowcurse.After Isobel gives this information, she is interrupted by the Absolute-tadpoled Flaming Fist, who attempts to kidnap her.
session_synopses.AD_CombatBetrayalReveal: Isobel announces player's betral during combat
session_synopses.FlamingSpy_Dead: SwD for the Flaming Fist Spy Marcus. Which questions is relevant may vary depending on the moment he dies (before the capture happens, during the capture or in Moonrise).
session_synopses.FollowUpSaved: Jaheira and Isobel (and the player) reunite after the fight with Marcus. Jaheira is relieved Isobel hasn't been captured. Isobel debriefs with player and sends them off on their main mission for Act 2. Both of them will be in heightened mood, having just survived a fierce battle- not totally out of breath, but still recovering from the immediate battle.

PAD_SeluneShrine.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_SeluneShrine.context: NodeContext: Arc - SH is loyal to shar

PAD_SeluneShrine.speaker: Player
PAD_SeluneShrine.text: Perhaps they had no choice but to hide.

PAD_MeenlockReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_MeenlockReaction.context: NodeContext: a monster has appeared before you - [prn. Mean-lock]

PAD_MeenlockReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_MeenlockReaction.text: Their eyes are made for the dark - fire and light is our friend.
PAD_MeenlockReaction.context: NodeContext: a monster has appeared before you, trying to warn your fellow player

session_synopses.PAD_SeluneShrine: Comment on the Selunite shrine at 35; 0; -694 in Haven.
session_synopses.PAD_MeenlockReaction: This fight occurs in the basement of the last light inn. Meenlocks are clawed fey creatures. If the player passes a check they identify them and their most dangerous aspect, otherwise they simply reccognise  what the meenlocks are and realise they are sensitive to light (light spell or torch for instance). If they fail, they can make note of their sharp claws (for instance.)

Lanceboard_AD.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_AD.text: This game's awful. Why's anyone play it?
Lanceboard_AD.context: NodeContext: pretending to be bad at the game (she's actually amazing at it)

Lanceboard_AD.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_AD.text: It hones a strategic mind, my dear. Take your turn.

Lanceboard_AD.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_AD.context: NodeContext: pretending to be bad at the game (she's actually amazing at it)

MolMoving.text: Look, you're welcome and all, but I've gotta chat with bigger fish. Later.
MolMoving.context: NodeContext: clearly in a rush and needs to go

AD_NoticedStolenBoard.speaker: Mol

session_synopses.Lanceboard_AD: ADs for Mol and Raphael as they play lanceboard. Mol is pretending to be unskilled and disinterested in the game.
session_synopses.MolMoving: Back up line after Mol has vouched for the player and is running back to last light in to play a game of lanceboard with raphael.
session_synopses.AD_NoticedStolenBoard: Mol reacts to the player having stolen and put the lanceboard elsewhere.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: That eye. In Tymora's name, Wyll? What's happened to you?

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: That eye. In Tymora's name, Wyll? What's happened to you?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to playerNodeContext: Notices player suddenly. HAnd to brow in exasperation.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: A devil deal gone horribly wrong.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: A devil deal? Have you lost your - hm, forget it. Your soul is your own for the dealing. Your father's? That's a different matter.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Gods, please, no. You were supposed to be my wildcard.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to playerNodeContext: Notices player suddenly. HAnd to brow in exasperation.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: We believe the cultists have taken Duke Ravengard to Moonrise Towers. I don't suppose you've found a way in?

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: I don't suppose you've found a way into the Towers?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What's with the fellow in the cot?

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Isobel cleared this place, and he just... appeared. We think he was staying at the inn when the curse fell - which means he's been trapped inside for a century.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: It beggars belief he's alive at all.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Hopefully he'll come 'round. Tell us something useful about getting through the shadows. Right now he seems to have little more to him than a refrain from some song or other.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What can you tell me about Isobel?

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Cleric of Selûne - she's got a room upstairs if you want to meet her. Just don't interrupt her while she's doing whatever it is that keeps this place shadow-free.

session_synopses: Florrick is with her Flaming Fist troops in Haven. As you approach, they are furiously trying to put a plan together to rescue Ravengard. The curse is one thing, but Ketheric is invincible. They can't just storm the place. And even if they could, they would execute the prisoners if the alarm was raised - including the Grand Duke.Florrick turns to you, incredibly grateful that we have made it so far. She implores you to work with Jaheira for her rescue efforts, but tells you your priority is clear: Duke Ravengard. He must be returned to the city - it will not survive his absence.

PAD_TooHeavy.speaker: Player
PAD_TooHeavy.context: NodeContext: tried to shove some rocks in game and they were too heavy

session_synopses.PAD_TooHeavy: The players are trying to disassemble a pile of rocks.Potentially, Marcus has told them about it.

ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.speaker: Player
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.text: It's those damn shadows. Be ready!
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.context: NodeContext: start of combat - high tension situation. [Astarion - realises the shadows are attacking]

ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.speaker: Player
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.text: No hesitation - these people are long dead.
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.context: NodeContext: start of combat - high tension situation.

session_synopses.ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat: SCL Haven: Isobel is kidnapped/killed and shadows engulf the inn, combat starts against the shadows. Players find themselves in the middle of it protecting the inn or just because they haven't escaped.

True

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: Chk. Why would anyone keep such neurotic creatures as pets?

session_synopses: Cat is hanging around Barcus' workshop. Cat is not very friendly and player won't really be able to change the cat into being friendly, only temporarily not-aggro. If the player intimidates the cat, they can convince the cat to leave into the shadowcurse. Might do followup in future but none planned now. If placated, cat will tell player not to trust Isobel.

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: Flesh! Flank-flesh!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Feral, starving - catching player's scent

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: Foot-flesh!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Feral, starving - catching player's scent

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: SILENCE!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Throwing up a hand to silence her comrades to either sideNodeContext: Silencing her comrades, turning to speak to player head-on

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: We hunger, True Soul. The Absolute promised us a feast of corpses, and still we starve!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Just as starving and feral as her companions, but a better grip on herself.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The Absolute owes you nothing. You owe Her your faith.

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: She had it - until She kept the real feast from us!

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: They drop corpses down into the tunnels below the tower. Enough to feed an army of us!

node_data.speaker: Winged Horror
node_data.text: If the Absolute will not share Her dead flesh... we will tear it from the backs of the living.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Shifting to a hostile tone, threatening us

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Symbol on NPC glowsInternalNodeContext: Delete if you are talking to a companion.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Attack.

session_synopses: The player encounters a pack of winged ghouls on Moonrise's upper exterior. They are disgusting undead who are eternally starving for dead and rotting flesh. Though intelligent, they can be near feral in their need to feed.In this case, the player meets a still-intelligent one with two less-bright comrades. The leader challenges the player, saying the cult has promised them plenty of meat but they've received none. Instead, the corpses are dropped below the tower (unbeknownst to them, to be fed to the Elder Brain or used in the Necromancer's experiments)

AD_TentacleShaft.speaker: Player
AD_TentacleShaft.text: Something slimy seems to be dripping from the rafters above.

DaisyAD_FeignSuprise.text: Whatever that creature was, its telepathic force was unlike anything I've ever encountered. It must be the source of the Absolute.

session_synopses.AD_TentacleShaft: The player passed a perception check to recognise tendrils of organic matter drooping through a wall. Exploring the rafters above this spot leads to the tentacle scene.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_FeignSuprise: The player has just made contact with the tentacle in the wall of Moonrise (the Elder Brain). Daisy reacts.

AD_Minthara_EnteredLibrary.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredLibrary.text: Security is tight here. Z'rell made this library her command post.

PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.speaker: Player
PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.text: Prisoners. I doubt they'll last long in here.

PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.speaker: Player
PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.text: Careful. One wrong move and we'll be behind bars with them.

AD_FlirtyTiefling.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling.context: NodeContext: leaving without the player, broken hearted and filled with regret

AD_TieflingsFreed.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_TieflingsFreed.context: NodeContext: yelling with authority and confidence

AD_TieflingInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection.text: Few survive Disciple Balthazar's experiments. This is your chance to submit to the Absolute - to find peace.
AD_TieflingInspection.context: NodeContext: this is, in a strange way, the warden trying to be comforting, even if it comes across cruel

AD_TieflingInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection.text: I am far gentler than Disciple Balthazar. You wish to live? Grow a spine.
AD_TieflingInspection.context: NodeContext: rubbing salt in the wound

AD_TieflingInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection.text: Or, if you're very lucky, perhaps he will split you open and sew in a new one.
AD_TieflingInspection.context: NodeContext: a venemous smile at her cruel words

AD_GnomesInJail.speaker: Nimble
AD_GnomesInJail.context: NodeContext: scared and a little frantic

AD_GnomesInJail.speaker: Nickels
AD_GnomesInJail.text: There's something evil here. Below, down, down... argh!
AD_GnomesInJail.context: NodeContext: scared and panicked, noise of pain at 'argh'. Clutches head briefly

AD_GnomesInJail.context: NodeContext: doesn't really give a shit his comrade is scrared - focused on himself and the plan

ProdigyBrother.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother.text: Don't talk to us. You're just making it worse.
ProdigyBrother.context: NodeContext: player has refused to help you - furious

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Cal

AD_ProdigiesInJail.context: NodeContext: frantic, looking through the bars, panicked

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigiesInJail.text: Let's focus on escaping, all right?

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigiesInJail.text: We'll give Rolan the send off he deserves - when we're both safe.

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Cal
AD_ProdigiesInJail.text: You're right. Let's... let's talk about something else.
AD_ProdigiesInJail.context: NodeContext: heartbroken, but knows lia is right

AD_ToolRefused.speaker: Wulbren Bongle

Guard_004.speaker: Zealot Nadi

GnomePrisoner_002.speaker: Nickels
GnomePrisoner_002.text: Nimble said to close my eyes. But I can hear it - the stone is screaming.

Boat.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Boat.text: Boat's good to go - all that's left is to ship off.
Boat.context: NodeContext: tense but relieved - they've made it to the boat and are about to flee moonrise

Boat.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Boat.text: My plan, for now, is to hide out on the water. Unless you have a better idea?

Boat.speaker: Player
Boat.text: If I were you, I'd stay on the water. But it's your call.

Boat.speaker: Danis
Boat.text: True - anywhere is better than here.
Boat.context: NodeContext: worried but trying to be confident

Boat.speaker: Danis
Boat.text: But I can't leave without saying this - something big is going on in Moonrise. I heard whispers of something - an army. Do what you have to here, and then leave. Soon.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia

ProdigySister.context: NodeContext: disgust - assumes player is a traitor

ProdigySister.speaker: Player
ProdigySister.text: I'm not with the cultists - I swear it.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: If you're not at the Absolute's beck and call, why are you here?

ProdigySister.speaker: Player
ProdigySister.text: To help. What can I do?

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
