HarperCaster_000.text: But the curse is at its strongest between here and there. You won't even reach the tower unless you can survive the darkest shadows.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: There's a cultist convoy that brings supplies and personnel to the tower - by some strange magic, they move through the curse unharmed.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: With your help, we'll ambush them, and seize their secret. When we do, it's yours, and the path to Moonrise will be open.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: All right. But hurry it along, yeah?

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: Your worshippers, Majesty. What happened here?
CaravanStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider arrives to find the camp deserted apart from you and some dead goblins.InternalNodeContext: Drider arrives to find the camp has been slaughteredNodeContext: Looking around at dead goblins - his allies have been slaughtered

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns and looks at the player with malevolenceNodeContext: Turns and looks at the player with malevolence

CaravanStart.speaker: Player
CaravanStart.text: I just found them like this.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: At least these have survived. At least we return with some faithful.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: But we should depart. Are they ready to leave?
CaravanStart.context: NodeContext: Looks out to the dark, then back to players

CaravanStart.speaker: Lae'zel
CaravanStart.text: Every step into the darkness leads us away from the crèche. Cleansing awaits - do not lose sight of our prize.

CaravanStart.speaker: Player
CaravanStart.text: What's out there? What makes the shadows so dangerous?

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: Hungry shades and cursed darkness. Cursed by a lesser god, but dangerous all the same, oh yes.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: Our queen's light will keep them at bay. Will keep us safe as we guide Her faithful to Her temple, but only if they stay close.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: So why are we still waiting, Majesty? Why have we not left?

CaravanStart.speaker: Player
CaravanStart.text: I need to do something first. You wait here.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: We will wait for a time, Majesty, but not long. The shadows are getting closer - we cannot wait long.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: Listen - if you want to reach Moonrise, you're going to need help. And I know where you'll find it.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: There's a cultist convoy that passes each day. It carries a lantern that burns the curse away.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: You're going to seize that lantern - and I'm going to help you. Just say the word.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: Let's take on that convoy. You lead, I follow.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: Wonderful. I will mark your map, so you can find us, should you lose the way.

AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush.text: All right. You ready for this?

CINE_CaravanIntro.text: CinematicNodeContext: The player pauses as they hear nearby footfalls. They crouch down and observe.
CINE_CaravanIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player pauses as they hear nearby footfalls. They crouch down and observe.

CINE_CaravanIntro.speaker: Kar'niss
CINE_CaravanIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player observes as the drider caravan moves into frame (wide shot).NodeContext: Urging the caravan along.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts lantern and illuminates their face.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts lantern and illuminates their face.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in player's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Player stows the lantern.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: Jaheira's godsend. Such strange company you keep.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.NodeContext: Very suspicious

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: I meant to infiltrate the cult. You've ruined the mission.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: Your mission is fiction, snake - and Harpers do not ally with liars. We silence them.

WaitingDuringEscort.speaker: Kar'niss
WaitingDuringEscort.text: Do not stray from the light, little one. The shadows are hungry.
WaitingDuringEscort.context: NodeContext: panicking a little, twitchy. Stopped momentarily in a dangerous region

WaitingDuringEscort.speaker: Kar'niss
WaitingDuringEscort.text: I do not lead. I follow Her voice - it calls us to Moonrise. Come!
WaitingDuringEscort.context: NodeContext: Religious certainty - the 'Her' is his god

AtTower.speaker: Kar'niss
AtTower.text: An interloper receives the Majesty's blessing before us?
AtTower.context: NodeContext: Looking at us with barely-reined in disgust - he is more deserving thatn we are, surely

AtTower.speaker: Kar'niss
AtTower.context: NodeContext: Leaning forward with glint of madness - could be take as encouragement or threat

AD_Harper_Melee_000.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harper_Melee_000.text: I fear neither shadow nor death.
AD_Harper_Melee_000.context: NodeContext: during combat, like a prayer, reassuring self

HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.text: Splendid show - newsworthy, even! Where's Volo Geddarm when you need him?

HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.text: Go on, check the drider. The lantern's yours for the taking.

Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower.speaker: Bedi
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower.text: Her cathedral will stand in the city, True Soul. On the bones of all Baldurians.
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower.context: NodeContext: grave, taking himself too seriously

Caravan_HalfOrcMelee.speaker: Bedi
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee.text: Stay sharp. These shadows can sneak up on you.

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.speaker: Player
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.text: Looks like the drider's caravan came from here.

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.speaker: Player
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.text: Cages, shackles... all prepared to march captives off to their fate.

AD_Harper_Caster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harper_Caster_000.context: NodeContext: wary but energetic, in combat

Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower.text: No food waiting for us? 'S barbaric. They got plenty of prisoners for the roasting.
Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower.context: NodeContext: whining - end of a long shift and they haven't been fed

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: You mean to reach Moonrise. And I've orders to help you.

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: The path to the Towers is drenched in blackness so deep, even a torch cannot quell it.

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: Yet the cultists have found a way to move freely. Whatever this method, you must claim it.

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: A cultist convoy crosses the land as we speak. I've readied an ambush. Say the word, and we fly.

AD_EscortInterrupted.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_EscortInterrupted.text: Return to the light! Do not stray!
AD_EscortInterrupted.context: NodeContext: Drider notices the player has left the safety of the caravan and wandered off into dangerous ground

Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_AtTower.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_AtTower.text: Wish we was assigned to the war camp. Beer's surely better down there.

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.text: Haven't we waited long enough, Bran?

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.text: We'll wait as long as it takes.

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.text: As long as it takes for what?

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.text: For the winds to blow in our favour.

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.text: Ain't you worried about the shadows?

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.text: Nope. 'Cause I ain't a little coward.

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower.text: Absolute's blessing on ya. Maybe Her design will throw us together again sometime.

AD_KillsSomeone.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_KillsSomeone.text: For the Absolute! For my queen!

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower.text: It was an honour to walk the shadows at your side. A little more inviting here though, eh?
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower.context: NodeContext: formal, making a slight joke at the end

AD_Harper_Ranger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_Harper_Ranger_000.context: NodeContext: in combat, menacing your enemies

AD_Warning.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_Warning.text: If they wander, we will not be responsible.

AD_Warning.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_Warning.text: If they die, it is their own fault.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.context: NodeContext: Bows their head slightly. This is their first time meeting a revered true soul

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.text: Why do you need a lyre, exactly?

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.text: I admit, I'm surprised a True Soul does not know this. Where are you headed, exactly?

AD_AfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_AfterAmbush.text: Shadows and heretics, Majesty. But they won't stop us. They can't stop us.
AD_AfterAmbush.context: NodeContext: Outburst - a little crazed as a whispering he's been hearing picks up again

AD_PlayerTakesMoonlantern.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_PlayerTakesMoonlantern.text: Return the lantern! You are not worthy to hold her light!

AD_ArriveToTollHouse.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.text: Stay close. The shadows are darkest here - hungriest here.
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.context: NodeContext: Warning the others in your caravan - you're entering a very dangerous area.

AD_ArriveToTollHouse.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.text: Do not stray from the light, no matter what they promise you.
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.context: NodeContext: Warning the others in your caravan - you're entering a very dangerous area.

HarperMelee_000.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000.text: We expect great things of you.

AD_CaravanConflict.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_CaravanConflict.text: You look twitchy, stone-skin. Afraid of the dark?

AD_CaravanConflict.speaker: Kansif
AD_CaravanConflict.text: In this place? Only a fool wouldn't be.

Caravan_GoblinRanger.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_GoblinRanger.text: I miss the camp. It's too quiet out here.

AD_AfterTollhouse.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_AfterTollhouse.text: There's the tower now, big lad. Your breeches still clean?
AD_AfterTollhouse.context: NodeContext: talking to a half-orc fellow-cultist, not to player

AD_AfterTollhouse.speaker: Kansif
AD_AfterTollhouse.text: My blade is. But that can change - just keep talking.
AD_AfterTollhouse.context: NodeContext: talking to a goblin who disrespected you, but it's a mostly-friendly rivalry

AD_AfterTollhouse.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_AfterTollhouse.text: They will be silent! They approach your sanctuary, Majesty.
AD_AfterTollhouse.context: NodeContext: 'they' are cultists he's leading, slightly crazed, talking to his 'god'

Caravan_GoblinMelee_000.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_GoblinMelee_000.text: Can we get movin'? Nabbed these boots from a gnome, and they don't bloody fit.

AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush.context: NodeContext: Very tense, but not shouting. Close to a loud whisper.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The hunter holds the lantern aloft. Its glow warms you through, chasing away the shadows in and around you.*

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in Harper's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Harper stows the lantern.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The Harper demands an explanation. Why did you travel with cultists?*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.NodeContext: Very suspicious

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: I meant to infiltrate the cult. You've ruined the mission.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The Harper acknowledges your explanation, grateful to see you in one piece.*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

AD_TollhouseFight.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_TollhouseFight.text: Pay no heed - onwards, to Moonrise!

HarperRanger_001.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001.text: You're the one Jaheira entrusted to infiltrate Moonrise, aren't you? Gods be with you.

HarperRanger_001.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001.text: The farther you stray from Last Light, the stronger the curse becomes - and Moonrise is beyond where the shadows are darkest.

HarperRanger_001.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001.text: You won't survive the journey without protection - and we know where you can find it.

HarperRanger_001.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001.text: We've been tracking cultists who pass through the shadows unharmed, guided by an uncanny light. We plan to steal it.

HarperRanger_001.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001.text: With your help, we'll destroy their convoy. Then you can forge a path to the tower, with their light to guide you.

HarperRanger_001.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001.text: Let's take them down. You lead, I follow.

HarperRanger_001.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001.text: Quickly, then. I will mark the rendezvous point, should you lose your way.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.text: Take a moment, Bran. Savour our victory over the drider.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.text: I'll celebrate when Ketheric's dead. Not before.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.text: We're still alive, Bran. That's worth a cheer, at the very least.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.text: Have you ever known me to cheer?

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000.text: I must be brief: if you intend to reach Moonrise, no torch nor blessing will fully guard you.

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000.text: Yet I know what can - a strange lantern, used by a cultist convoy that oft passes.

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000.text: Together, we will take it by force - you simply need speak the word.

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_000.text: Go on ahead. I'll catch up.

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000.text: Very well. I will mark your map.

HarperRanger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000.text: But do not be long. Our chances grow thinner with each moment that passes.

AD_BeforeAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_BeforeAmbush.text: They must keep up. The shadows are hungry.

AD_BeforeAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_BeforeAmbush.text: ...Patience, Majesty. You bless us with patience.
AD_BeforeAmbush.context: NodeContext: Taking a breath to stop from lashing out

Harper_Melee_000_AD_CombatStarts.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_CombatStarts.text: Take out the drider - we need that lantern!

CaravanAmbushed.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanAmbushed.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider raises a hand, bringing the caravan to a stop.

CaravanAmbushed.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanAmbushed.context: CinematicNodeContext: He raises the lantern, peering into the darkNodeContext: He raises the lantern, peering into the dark

CaravanAmbushed.speaker: Harper Elindale
CaravanAmbushed.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpers burst from hiding, Charging to attack the caravan

CaravanAmbushed.speaker: Narrator
CaravanAmbushed.text: *These Harpers are clearly enemies of the Absolute... they could be worthwhile allies. But defend the guide, and you may preserve your cover as a True Soul. *

CaravanAmbushed.speaker: Player
CaravanAmbushed.text: Turn on the caravan and attack the drider.

CaravanAmbushed.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanAmbushed.text: What are they doing? We thought they were True Souls! Traitors! Heathens!
CaravanAmbushed.context: NodeContext: talking about the players, who he had trusted until this point - furious and dismayed

AD_HarperTakesMoonlantern.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_HarperTakesMoonlantern.text: The heretics hold the lantern - take it back!

session_synopses.Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster: Combat AD for Kanslf, Half Orc caster in the driders caravan
session_synopses.ThanksAfterAmbush: While following the caravan, together with the players are ambushed by a group of players. If they side with the drider after the combat resolves it will thank them.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersAfterAmbush: Harpers are at the rendezvous point after the ambush reflecting about it.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersReachAmbushHouse: AD that triggers as harpers reach the house from which they will ambush the caravan.
session_synopses.Harper_Melee_000_AD_LassandraDies: Lassandra dies in combat with the drider. Branthos (also in combat with the drider) reacts.
session_synopses.Caravan_AD_Hyena: A playful, tame hyena is hanging around a goblin guard named Grim. Grim's having none of it.
session_synopses.HarperCaster_000: A Harper, getting ready for a mission that will see them trying to kill a drider - a big, dangerous monster. Main path only available when group dialogue is unavailable. This Harper is boisterous and eager.
session_synopses.CaravanStart: Dialog featuring a goblin and half-orc. Triggers the start of the caravan escort with the Drider appearing.The Drider is male, half-drow elf and half spider (bottom half). He carries a magical lantern to ward off the shadows
session_synopses.HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush: A Harper scout, getting ready to go back out into the cursed land that recently killed her friend. She's preparing to ambush a drider - a big, dangerous target. Her mood is somewhat grim.
session_synopses.AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush: Harper is waiting for the caravan at the ambush spot. After it the ambush starts and the caravan appears.Whispered and urgent - you're about to ambush someone.
session_synopses.CINE_CaravanIntro: The player spots the drider caravan approaching while exploring SCL (no harpers are present)
session_synopses.HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush: Harper leader after the fight with the Drider. You started the fight on drider's side, but switched and sided with the Harpers. They take the lantern and if you want it, you need to attack them or convince them to give it to you.
session_synopses.WaitingDuringEscort: Players were following the Drider accross the shadowlands but moved too far away from the caravan. The Drider will wait for the player to speak with it again before resuming the movement towards the tower.
session_synopses.AtTower: The Drider stands at the top of Moonrise tower - present just before we get our reward.
session_synopses.HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush: Harper Ranger after the fight with the Drider. You may or may not have started the fight on his side. After the ambush has ended, a prisoner threatens you, telling you to hand over the lantern.
session_synopses.Caravan_AD_HalfOrcAndGoblinAtCheckpoint: AD between the goblin and the half-orc when the entire caravan is at the checkpoint.
session_synopses.Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower: This guard was part of the caravan that brought us to Moonrise. Looking around the tower ruins, unimpressed.
session_synopses.Caravan_HalfOrcMelee: Half-Orc at the edge of the shadow curse. Stoic and focused on the job.
session_synopses.HarpersAndPlayersAmbush: The players have agreed to help the Harpers ambush a caravan of Absolute cultists and prisoners. You've just arrived at the ambush site - the mood is tense, words are spoken in harsh whispers. When the Caravan arrives there's a monsterous drider at its head, muttering to itself, talking to an imaginary queen/majesty that represents the voice of his God, The Absolute. The player can try to trick the drider into handing over its magic lantern (the Moonlantern - a glowing lantern hanging from the end of a staff), although that could leave the drider exposed to the worst effects of the curse. Will likely end in combat, either because you signaled the Harpers to spring their ambush or because the drider got suspicious and attacked.
session_synopses.PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint: Players met the caravan alone or with the harpers and backtracked towards where the caravan was waiting the Drider.
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower: A goblin guard who reached Moonrise Towers with us. Currently idle as they await their new orders.
session_synopses.HarpersAtInn: The players encounter a squad of Harpers at the Last Light Inn who're preparing to set out on a dangerous mission to ambush a drider and some cultists in the shadow-cursed lands. Lassandra, a Harper scout that the player may have helped previously, might be there.
session_synopses.AD_EscortInterrupted: Drider pauses the escort because someone was left behind. Drider's tone is a little sharp - it's his responsibility to make sure the caravan he's escorting gets to its destination safely.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush: A group of Harpers are standing outside an inn They had been preparing a dangerous ambush, but now the leader has another idea. The other Harpers are growing impatient.
session_synopses.Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp: Two of the three goblins discussing at the checkpoint. The tracker is nervous, looking to chat to distract himself. Vez is absolutely uninterested.
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower: The caravan has come to a stop at Moonrise Towers. Gronag is one of the guards idling outside until they're sent back out into the dark.
session_synopses.AD_KillsSomeone: Drider kills someone during the ambush encounter.
session_synopses.Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower: Kansif is now safe inside Moonrise Towers after delivering us there.
session_synopses.AD_Warning: Drider warns players and caravan not to move too far away from the light - otherwise the Moonlantern won't protect them.
session_synopses.Caravan_HalfOrcCaster: Player approaches Kansif (a stoic, honourable male half-orc) and Brawler Vez (a mouthy female goblin) after clearing a checkpoint and entering their camp in the Shadowcurse. They two Absolute cultists assume you're a True Soul sent by Minthara (which may or may not be true) and will ask if you brought the lyre needed to summon their guide through the darkness. If you have, you can play it and the drider will emerge. If you haven't, they can tell you where to find it.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersReachTree: AD that triggers near a tree at the shadowlands.
session_synopses.AD_AfterAmbush: Kicks off conflict between two or more caravan members if they are all alive at the bridge next to the town, after the harpers' ambush.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerTakesMoonlantern: Player takes the moonlantern and wasn't on the drider's side.
session_synopses.AD_ArriveToTollHouse: Drider arrives to the toll house and tells everyone to stay close to him.
session_synopses.HarperMelee_000: Harper one-line, with faith that the player will guide them to victory against the big bad Ketheric Thorm.
session_synopses.AD_CaravanConflict: Kicks off conflict between two or more caravan members if they are all alive at the bridge next to the town, after the harpers' ambush.
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinRanger: Goblin at the edge of the shadow curse. Misses the party back at the camp - this place is unsettling.
session_synopses.AD_AfterTollhouse: Kicks off conflict between two or more caravan members if they are all alive at the bridge next to the town, after the harpers' ambush.
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinMelee_000: If the player has been allowed entry to the camp, they can talk to this goblin to learn that they are waiting for a harp from Minthara with which to summon a guide that will protect them from the shadow curse on the path to Moonrise and if they haven't got it, they need to get it from Minthara. If the player has killed Minthara and hasn't already told the checkpoint goblin, they can mention it here.
session_synopses.AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush: AD as a group of Harpers move through the shadow curse. They're moving at a quick pace, trying to speak quietly. The mood is tense.
session_synopses.HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush: Narrator nodes for the after ambush. Dialgo shared between Elindale, Manus and Lassandra.
session_synopses.AD_TollhouseFight: Drider sees any of the tollhouse collector booster NPCs in combat while traversing the tollhouse in TWN.
session_synopses.HarperRanger_001: A Harper, possibly getting ready for a mission that will see them trying to kill a drider - a big, dangerous monster.
session_synopses.AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush: | 1st case scenario : Harpers came back victorious from the drider ambush and they are chatting about it back at the inn. || 2nd case scenario : Player went at the ambush without the harpers and they are now left with no lantern and nothing to do, |
session_synopses.HarperRanger_000: A Harper, proposing a mission that will see them trying to kill a drider.
session_synopses.Caravan_GoblinMelee_001: A goblin plays with a hyena (if it is still alive). Grumpy.
session_synopses.AD_BeforeAmbush: Second caravan AD between the bridge and the ambush.
session_synopses.CaravanAmbushed: Harpers ambush the caravan and the players. If this dialog succeeds on starting, the players can decide to fight the Harpers or change sides and help the ambushers fight the drider.

PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.text: Dark Justiciars fell here. Those signs we saw before were no coincidence - they led us here.
PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.context: NodeContext: Captivated. Arc: SH is loyal to shar. Starting to vocalise a sneaking suspicion that this temple is a legendary Sharran site, before dismissing the thought.

session_synopses.PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains: Shadowheart finds the remains of the Dark Justiciars and based on her level of knowledge will make a comment. All of them meant to build up anticipation for the Shar Temple. Can be triggered multiple times.

GithExplorer_Dead.speaker: Dead Githyanki Warrior
GithExplorer_Dead.context: NodeContext: This is a brave warrior who died from a silly child's game

session_synopses.GithExplorer_Dead: This githyanki is already dead when the player finds them. They came from the nearby crèche and died at the hands of Oliver's shadow-infested father, whose axe is embedded in her still.

AD_CreepyNoises001.speaker: Object
AD_CreepyNoises001.text: She was no fun. All I wanted was to play.
AD_CreepyNoises001.context: NodeContext: Disappointed. Referring to a dead githyanki the player comes across.

AD_CreepyNoises.speaker: Oliver
AD_CreepyNoises.text: Someone's coming. Someone new. Maybe they want to play.
AD_CreepyNoises.context: NodeContext: Hushed anticipation. Little giggle at the end.

session_synopses.AD_CreepyNoises001: The player hears creepy noises on the path to the house haunted by a shadow family.
session_synopses.AD_CreepyNoises: As the player approaches the abandoned house, they hear strange noises from inside, as if someone still lived there.

PAD_ShadowheartResistant.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartResistant.text: I can feel the shadows' power here... but they don't seem to be harming me?
PAD_ShadowheartResistant.context: NodeContext: Some confusion. She seems to have resistance in a shadow-cursed environment  that's affecting all others.

PAD_LightsSnuffedOut.speaker: Player
PAD_LightsSnuffedOut.text: Hells. Torchlight won't last long here.

EmperorAD_CompanionCursed.text: Your ally is falling to the curse. Help them.

PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.text: The Dark Lady shields me - I can feel her.
PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.context: NodeContext: Commenting on having divine protection from a shadow curse that affects all others

PAD_ShadowheartBlight.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBlight.text: Even Lady Shar's blessings cannot protect me here.
PAD_ShadowheartBlight.context: NodeContext: Commenting on losing Shar's protection against a shadow curse (venturing into where its strongest)

session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartResistant: Shadowheart comments on how she is resistant to the first layer of the curse.
session_synopses.PAD_LightsSnuffedOut: You're walking through an area where the shadow curse is strong and your torch gets snuffed out by the curse.
session_synopses.EmperorAD_CompanionCursed: Used exclusively when players have a companion left unattended/unhooked and without any protection against the curse. Goes hand in hand with a switch to turn based mode.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBlessed: Shadowheart comments on feeling Shar's protection against the curse return.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBlight: Shadowheart comments on feeling Shar's protection fade.

PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale.speaker: Player
PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale.text: That's odd. The flame won't go out.

PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale.speaker: Player
PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale.text: Ah - a Continual Flame. Nothing can douse it, near as I can tell.

session_synopses.PAD_TouchedTorches_WithGale: Party remarks on torches they cannot extinguish.

AD_Goblins_AtTower.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_Goblins_AtTower.text: Wonder if there's dancing down in the war camp. Feelin' frisky.
AD_Goblins_AtTower.context: NodeContext: Despite the playful phrase, makes it sound threatening.

session_synopses.AD_Goblins_AtTower: Goblins relaxing at Moonrise Towers after arriving with the Drider's caravan.

Circle_PAD.speaker: Player
Circle_PAD.text: A ritual circle. Looks like it was used in the crafting of Moonlanterns.

session_synopses.Circle_PAD: Players have clicked on a hidden ritual circle on a desk in SCL.The second option triggers if Gale already knows how to use it.

PAD_FlowersAtHouse.speaker: Player
PAD_FlowersAtHouse.text: Flowers blooming in shadow. This is the sign Halsin mentioned.

AD_Dome75PercentHP.speaker: Oliver
AD_Dome75PercentHP.text: Stop that! You're supposed to be playing, not breaking things!
AD_Dome75PercentHP.context: NodeContext: Angry (player is trying to break through a protective magic dome guarding Oliver)

AD_AfterHideAndSeek.speaker: Oliver
AD_AfterHideAndSeek.text: You were good. But just you wait - I'll get better.
AD_AfterHideAndSeek.context: NodeContext: A little miffed at losing/considering ways to improve his hide & seek game

Acceptance.speaker: Oliver
Acceptance.text: I'm not leaving - you can't make me!

Acceptance.speaker: Halsin
Acceptance.text: Be gentle. He's much more than a child, but he doesn't truly know that.
Acceptance.context: NodeContext: Discreet, advisory. Doesn't want to upset Oliver any more than he already is.

Acceptance.speaker: Player
Acceptance.text: You're just a thieving shadow that thinks it's a child. Playtime's over - Thaniel's waiting.

Acceptance.speaker: Oliver
Acceptance.text: You're a bad winner, but you're still a winner. I'll go - you've taken everything that I cared about.

Acceptance.speaker: Halsin
Acceptance.text: You didn't need to be so hard on him.
Acceptance.context: NodeContext: Disapproving. We said something unnecessarily harsh to Oliver

Acceptance.speaker: Oliver
Acceptance.text: I hope you're nicer to Thaniel than you are to me.

AD_SummoningPlush.speaker: Oliver
AD_SummoningPlush.context: NodeContext: he's summoning toys to fight the players - malicious, but playful

session_synopses.PAD_FlowersAtHouse: PAD commenting on the unusual fact that flowers are growing around Olver's House despite it being in the Shadowcurse.
session_synopses.AD_Dome75PercentHP: This AD happens when you damage nightdome and bring it below 75%.
session_synopses.AD_AfterHideAndSeek: After playing with Oliver hide and seek for two times he will stay at his house. Depending on how the player did, he'll be left thinking about new ideas on how to improve his hide and seek abilities or happy because they didn't find him without alerting/killing the shadows.
session_synopses.Acceptance: Dialog with Oliver, in which the player confronts him and convinces him to rejoin Thaniel, his other half. so that the shadow curse can be lifted. Oliver will always return to Thaniel after this dialogue, but the player can be harsh or gentle in how they do so.
session_synopses.AD_SummoningPlush: AD that Oliver plays when he summons his Plush during the fight at the plaza in Shadow Cursed Town

PAD_InvestigatedTiefling.speaker: Player
PAD_InvestigatedTiefling.text: Gored to death, by the look of it.
PAD_InvestigatedTiefling.context: NodeContext: Commenting on a tiefling who was gored to death

session_synopses.PAD_InvestigatedTiefling: The player finds a dead tiefling near the refugee's abandoned caravan. The tiefling was killed by the shadowcursed ox. The player rolls a Medicine check to determine the tiefling's death

AD_HarperScout_000_WrongWarning.speaker: Harper Lassandra
AD_HarperScout_000_WrongWarning.text: That's not the way - come back!

AD_HarperScout_003_Combat.speaker: Harper Karrow
AD_HarperScout_003_Combat.text: Yonas, no! What are you doing?

AD_HarperScout_000_Combat.speaker: Harper Lassandra
AD_HarperScout_000_Combat.text: Cut the beast down! Take its light!

session_synopses.AD_HarperScout_000: Brief AD when player first spots the harpers to establish their presence before the big dialogue.
session_synopses.AD_HarperScout_000_WrongWarning: After saving them from shadow creatures, the Harper Scouts are guiding the player through SCL to Last Light.This AD plays if the player goes in the wrong direction.
session_synopses.AD_HarperScout_003_Combat: Combat AD for Harper Karrow in SCL
session_synopses.AD_HarperScout_003_LeaveWarning: After saving the Harper Scouts from the Shadow creatures in SCL, the player tries to leave without telling the Harpers they're ready to go.
session_synopses.Dead_HarperScout_000: Speak with dead dialogue with Lassandra, a harper scout. The player can ask her corpse, who she is, what she was doing etc, possibly learning of Last Light, a nearby refuge against shadow curse.
session_synopses.BridgePoint_001: Default dialogue for Meygan once they reach the bridge into the Last Light, before the player's spoken to Jaheira.

AD_Sign.speaker: Narrator
AD_Sign.text:
*North - Last Light Inn
South - Risen Road
West - Reithwin Town*

session_synopses.AD_Sign: Signpost between the Risen Road and Last Light, also points across a chasm towards the town

PAD_FindAnimal.speaker: Player
PAD_FindAnimal.text: The animal never had a chance. The curse consumes everything it touches.

session_synopses.PAD_FindAnimal: The party encounters a dead Shadow Cursed animal and comment on how the Shadow Curse consumes everything

VB_DirtpileGas.speaker: Player
VB_DirtpileGas.text: Argh! This air is foul with rot. Better be careful...

StayInSCL.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
StayInSCL.text: If you intend to stray from Moonrise while Ketheric still lives, I shall remain at camp, strategising his downfall.

StayInSCL.speaker: Player
StayInSCL.text: I have unfinished business to attend to before dealing with Ketheric.

StayInSCL.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
StayInSCL.text: I do not. All that I did before you rescued me was as a puppet of the Absolute - it is behind me. Until Ketheric falls, only vengeance remains.

session_synopses.StayInSCL: Minthara tells the player her business is in SCL now and she will not leave.

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with dead dialog if players leaves the area where the goblin was and comes back. They will find the corpse of the goblin killed by the shadows.

AD_LostGoods.speaker: Narrator
AD_LostGoods.text: *A pile of belongings, forsaken to the curse so that their owners could escape with their lives.*

session_synopses.AD_LostGoods: Lost goods and piles of valuables - sacks, chests, boxes, backpacks left behind by people dashing out to save their lives.

PAD_FoundFootprints.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundFootprints.text: Paw prints? Where do they lead?

session_synopses.PAD_FoundFootprints: This PAD occurs when the player approaches a set of tracks near a ledge. If the player jumps down, they will find a burrow with a ring inside.

AD_CaravanLeaves.speaker: Warrior Gronag
AD_CaravanLeaves.context: NodeContext: angry - yelling at a hyena to be quiet

session_synopses.AD_CaravanLeaves: Hyena runs away and goblin reacts to it.

AD_MagicSkull.speaker: Herald of Balthazar
AD_MagicSkull.context: NodeContext: Ill-tempered warning from a skull being remotely voiced by a necromancer.

PAD_MagicLockedDoor.speaker: Player
PAD_MagicLockedDoor.text: Some sort of magic blocking the way.

PAD_PushedByRing.speaker: Player
PAD_PushedByRing.text: Almost made it that time - just have to watch my step.
PAD_PushedByRing.context: NodeContext: Just been repulsed by an invisible kinetic force that threw them a few feet backwards.

session_synopses.PAD_StatueReaction: Players enter the crypt and react to the statue.
session_synopses.AD_MagicSkull: The skull taunts the player to not go forward, declaring that everything is already being handled.
session_synopses.PAD_MagicLockedDoor: Player interacts with the door locked by magic at the crypt before solving the puzzle.
session_synopses.PAD_PushedByRing: Player reacts to being pushed by the rings in the crypt of the Shar temple.

PAD_MyrkulSymbol.speaker: Player
PAD_MyrkulSymbol.text: What is that symbol supposed to mean?

PAD_MakeshiftVessel.speaker: Player
PAD_MakeshiftVessel.text: What is that? Almost looks like someone was trying to grow a person.

PAD_KethericsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_KethericsMap.text: Looks like there's a temple under this place - and something deadly sealed inside it.

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.text: Isobel. That's the name of the cleric at Last Light Inn, right?

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.text: Can she possibly be Ketheric's daughter?

PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.speaker: Player
PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.text: Balthazar, a necromancer lap dog of Ketheric Thorm's.

PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.speaker: Player
PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.text: Who knows what he may have up his rotten sleeve.

PAD_TempleSuspicion.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_TempleSuspicion.text: There has to be more to this place. There has to be a reason I came to be here.
PAD_TempleSuspicion.context: NodeContext: Strong suspcion that she's somewhere important for her. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

PAD_FoundDisc_2Players.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundDisc_2Players.text: That disc looks like it can move - a way forward?

PAD_FoundDisc_2Players.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundDisc_2Players.text: Where will it bring us, though?

PAD_Mural_000.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Mural_000.text: *Moonrise Towers. It makes the Urge hiss within. It was part of your disgrace, but how?*

PAD_KethericsWifePlaque.speaker: Narrator
PAD_KethericsWifePlaque.text: *Here lies Melodia Thorm, beloved wife and mother. Ai armiel telere maenen hir.*
PAD_KethericsWifePlaque.context: NodeContext: Ah-less-ia /  Ay Army-el Teller-eh Man-en here

session_synopses.PAD_MyrkulSymbol: Players enter the room where the symbol of Myrkul lies on the floor. Hard religion DC before the PAD plays.
session_synopses.PAD_MakeshiftVessel: Players find a vessel with a half-formed humanoid shape gestating inside and reacts accordingly. The being is just inert flesh and cannot speak.
session_synopses.PAD_KethericsMap: Players find the map Ketheric had inside the mausoleum. It shows  the entrance to the Shar Temple (behind Isobel's tomb) and has notes on an attack.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque: PAD for characters reacting to finding Isobels plaque in the Ketheric Mausoleum. Has 3 reaction states:- Already know Ketheric is Isobel's Father- Don't know aboutfamily relationship but have met Isobel- Don't know about family relationship and haven't met Isobel
session_synopses.PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro: Party reacts to a magic-mouth skull that projects Balthazar's voice, warning them to leave.
session_synopses.PAD_TempleSuspicion: Shadowheart comments on her suspicions that there is probably to the crypt than just a mausoleum. Hinting at the existence of the temple.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundDisc_2Players: Players find the disc at the mausoleum that leads to the Shar temple.
session_synopses.PAD_Mural_000: Player interacts with the first mural of the Mausoleum puzzle and get the first piece of the story. This mural depicts Moonrise Towers in its heyday, before it turned to darkness. The player's comment varies, depending on whether they've been to MRT or not.
session_synopses.PAD_KethericsWifePlaque: Reaction from player/narrator who interacts with the tomb of Isobel's mother (and Ketheric's wife).

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A small prickle of dread finds your heart as you look upon the altar.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands before an altar of Shar.

session_synopses: The player discovers an altar in the temple of Shar. They can choose to pray at it, with the chance to receive a buff or debuff depending on the outcome of a religion check. Shar and Selune tags automatically get buff and debuff respectively. Avatar Shadowheart gets a unique and ambigous outcome, casting some doubt on her standing with her goddess.

PAD_VictimsDisplay.speaker: Player
PAD_VictimsDisplay.text: A very gory idea of art.

AD_FormLines.speaker: Yurgir
AD_FormLines.text: Form up ranks! Don't let anything get past you!
AD_FormLines.context: NodeContext: During combat. Bellowing orders to his merregon soldiers to change formation

AD_VictimStand.speaker: Narrator
AD_VictimStand.text: *A foul totem of agony, mounted with sadistic relish.*

node_data.speaker: Yurgir
node_data.text: The song remains. Seems you haven't dealt with this imaginary Justiciar of yours.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Impatient growl

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I know what you're feeding that displacer charm potions. Curious way of ensuring the beast's loyalty.

node_data.speaker: Yurgir
node_data.text: Curious? No - effective. A hunter needs to ensure his tools are dependable.

node_data.speaker: Yurgir
node_data.text: Ensuring Nessa's loyalty is as important as having sharpened blades and an oiled crossbow.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're manipulating that creature.

node_data.speaker: Yurgir
node_data.text: Yes. Your point?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Deadpan.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It's wrong - even a beast like that shouldn't be treated in such a way.

node_data.speaker: Yurgir
node_data.text: Treated like what? Pampered? Fed? Given a master to adore?

node_data.speaker: Yurgir
node_data.text: Spare me your bleeding heart. Unless you'd like me to pluck it out and show it to you.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Just getting my bearings. This place is confounding.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Local flag unsets when the player acknowledges the Orthon's query in N200

node_data.speaker: Yurgir
node_data.text: Give it a decade, or ten - then you'll know it like the back of your hand.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dry

node_data.speaker: Yurgir
node_data.text: Though in truth, you won't have that long. Not even close.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Wicked, predatory. Anticipating the player's failure.

AD_MonitorLeaves.speaker: Raphael
AD_MonitorLeaves.context: NodeContext: annoyed, players just attacked him. He's unharmed, but teleports away, abandoning them

AD_BetrayedByDisplacer.speaker: Yurgir
AD_BetrayedByDisplacer.context: NodeContext: Surprised/somewhat distraught as his displacer beast companion turns on him mid-combat

session_synopses.PAD_VictimsDisplay: In Shar temple, there is a number of mutilated corpses - justiciars killed by Orthon. But he not only killed them, but he also created various installments of them, put them on spikes, hang them, etc
session_synopses.AD_FormLines: Orthon tells the merregons to get close to him during combat.
session_synopses.AD_VictimStand: Narrator AD that pops up when clicking on Orthons's victims on display in Shar temple. They are pretty different so text needs to be universally fitting.
session_synopses: This occurs if the player has successfully convinced the orthon to let them stay in his lair. They did so by telling him they'd search the temple for a way of freeing him from his contract.If the player resolves the Last Justiciar contract, they can inform Yurgir. If they killed the justiciar, Raphael will appear and negotiate with Yurgir. If the player spared the justiciar, they can confront and fight Yurgir.
session_synopses.AD_MonitorLeaves: Raphael leaves while at the Orthon, in case he is attacked.
session_synopses.AD_BetrayedByDisplacer: Orthon and Displacer fight between each other.

PAD_DarkJusticiar.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiar.text: Countless initiates walked these halls once, seeking to become Dark Justiciars.

PAD_DarkJusticiar.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiar.text: I will follow in their path. I will succeed.

PAD_ShadowheartIntro.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartIntro.text: I shall prove myself worthy, Lady Shar.

AD_LightTrialShadow.speaker: Shadow, Shadow
AD_LightTrialShadow.text: A true child of the Nightsinger embraces the shadows and passes unseen.

PAD_TeleportedByShadow.speaker: Player
PAD_TeleportedByShadow.text: Damn. That shade knocked me right back to the start.

PAD_PathOfDarknessFirstWarning.text: Unfortunate. Fail twice more, and my embrace may elude you.

PAD_SpotGem.speaker: Player
PAD_SpotGem.text: A gem. Looks like it might fit in the altar from before.
PAD_SpotGem.context: NodeContext: Karlach note: open to interpretation (to mean 'hey, I spotted it!)  but inspired by jimmy durante

PAD_PathOfDarknessHint.speaker: Player
PAD_PathOfDarknessHint.text: This must be what that book meant. I need to get across - and that means remembering where these platforms are.

PAD_MentalTortureHint.speaker: Player
PAD_MentalTortureHint.text: The book was clear - I need to fight myself if I'm to pass this trial.

PAD_PathOfDarknessSecondWarning.text: Disappointing. Succeed or fail, the next attempt shall be the last.

PAD_HaveAllGems.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_HaveAllGems.text: That's the last one. The inner sanctum is within reach now.

session_synopses.PAD_DarkJusticiar: Shadowheart is walking along the corridors of the trials and is clearly excited about the prospect of finally proving herself worthy.
session_synopses.PAD_ObjectOfDarknessPlaque: The player discovers the name of the Shar trial.
session_synopses.PAD_TortureRoomPlaque: The player discovers the name of the Shar trial.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartIntro: Shadowheart answers the Shar statue with affirmation.
session_synopses.PAD_TeleportedByShadow: A player was seen by a ghost while attempting the sneaking trial in the Shar Temple and teleported back to the beginning of the trial.
session_synopses.PAD_PathOfDarknessFirstWarning: Shar warns player that they only have two attempts left.
session_synopses.PAD_SpotGem: The player notices one of the Trial Gems and points it out. If the player knows that the altar requires the gems, they will reiterate the gem's use. Reactivity for finding additional gems subsequently.
session_synopses.PAD_PathOfDarknessHint: The player comments after possibly figuring out a clue to successfully completing one of the trials in the Temple of Shar. They must safely cross the room while remembering where the platforms along the way are.
session_synopses.PAD_MentalTortureHint: The player comments after entering one of the trial areas in the temple of Shar. If they read a book in the library before, they'll repeat a hint contained in it about how to complete the trial (defeat their double). Otherwise they'll plead ignorance.
session_synopses.PAD_PathOfDarknessSecondWarning: Shar warns player that they only have one attempt left.
session_synopses.PAD_HaveAllGems: Shadowheart reveals her anticipation and her eagerness to proceed once all trial gems have been collected to open the way to Nightsong.

NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.speaker: Balthazar
NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.text: A cheap attack, just as I'm finally reunited with my masterwork? This will not stand.
NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.context: InternalNodeContext: Balthazar is hostile to the player as they attacked him before the normal scene flow triggered.NodeContext: Furious.

session_synopses.NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro: Balthazar responds to the player's attack before becoming hostile

PAD_Unlocked.speaker: Player
PAD_Unlocked.text: The disc is moving. This must lead to the next part of Shar's Gauntlet.
PAD_Unlocked.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if you received knowledge of the Shar trials from the disc altar.NodeContext: [Astarion: 'bloody' as in annoying, not 'lots of blood]

Altar.speaker: Shadowheart
Altar.text: There's nothing more for us to do here - not until we complete Lady Shar's trials.

PAD_ShadowheartVista.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartVista.text: Lady Shar... so many must have toiled to make a visage so grand. It's beautiful...
PAD_ShadowheartVista.context: NodeContext: Overawed at the sight of a statue of liberty-sized representation of Shar, in  the heart of a huge temple.

session_synopses.PAD_Unlocked: Players unlock the disc/platform in the Shar temple for the first time.
session_synopses.Altar: The player approaches an altar dedicated to Shar. This altar is a call to action for the player to complete Shar's trials and become a Dark Justiciar.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartVista: Shadowheart sees the giant Shar Statue and lets it set in that she is in the temple of shar.

PAD_Shadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Shadowheart.text: Through there... there's something about it. Need to look.

session_synopses.PAD_Shadowheart: Shadowheart has sudden, mysterious hunch and is compelled to investigate a side area in the Temple of Shar. (this is an unconscious prompt from somewhere in her memory - entering the side area will trigger a flashback scene from her past).

node_data.speaker: Displacer Beast
node_data.text: What was that? I feel strange... clear.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You only love your master because he's been dosing this meat. He's manipulating you.
True

node_data.speaker: Displacer Beast
node_data.text: I remember... quick flesh, hot blood.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: The beast is initially outraged, but your logic is infallible, and awakens thoughts and feelings it has buried for a long time with the help of the charm potion.

node_data.speaker: Displacer Beast
node_data.text: Before master, my prey was alive.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Anger brewing

node_data.speaker: Displacer Beast
node_data.text: False master! Hind-legged liars, all! I'll shred you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Irrational with rage, extremely triggered

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The only liar here is your 'master'. Let's end him together.
True

node_data.speaker: Displacer Beast
node_data.text: There's truth in you, stranger.
node_data.context: NodeContext: reconsidering its position

node_data.speaker: Displacer Beast
node_data.text: I'll not start the fight but I'll help you end it.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Beginning to reckon with the truth, the beast begins to turn toward anger - though it can't get over its amorous feelings for the orthon. It's been charmed for too long.

session_synopses: Appears if the player tries to speak to the Displacer Beast. The player can learn that the beast is in love with the Orthon, and if they know that it has been charmed by him, they can attempt to convince it to join them in battle against the Orthon.

001.speaker: Merregon
001.context: NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

001.speaker: Merregon
001.context: NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *Your efforts reveal nothing. If the merregon is angry at your attempted intrusion, it doesn't show.*

000.speaker: Narrator
000.text: *This merregon seems faintly more alive than the others - beckoning you to look at its wares.*
000.context: CinematicNodeContext: The merregon beckons the player towards its waresInternalNodeContext: This greeting if you're speaking to the trader merregon for the first time after having read the mind of another merregon previously.

000.speaker: Hoarding Merregon
000.context: CinematicNodeContext: The merregon beckons the player towards its waresNodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

000.speaker: Hoarding Merregon
000.text: Fill master's coffers. Tend to his beast. Feed it potions. Keep it charmed.
000.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the merregon wasn't told it was no longer in charge of the displacerNodeContext: A droning, almost mindless refrain

000.speaker: Narrator
000.text: *It seems this merregon is using potions to charm a beast on behalf of its master.*

002.speaker: Merregon
002.context: NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

002.speaker: Merregon
002.context: NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

002.speaker: Narrator
002.text: *The merregon's mind is sealed. It doesn't even react to your attempted intrusion.*

session_synopses.001: A merregon - a footsoldier from hell assigned to assist the Orthon ( a huge infernal bounty hunter). Outside of combat, the merregon is unspeaking and unreactive. Upon attempting to read its thoughts, you realise it's little more than an empty vessel, without personality or thought.
session_synopses.000: One of the merregon henchmen accompanying the orthon in his lair in the Shar Temple. This one acts as a trader and beastmaster for the Orthon's displacer beast. The player can trade, learn about the merregon's connection to the displacer via detect thoughts, and convince it to hand over the potions used to control the beast.
session_synopses.002: A merregon - a footsoldier from hell assigned to assist the Orthon ( a huge infernal bounty hunter). Outside of combat, the merregon is unspeaking and unreactive. Upon attempting to read its thoughts, you realise it's little more than an empty vessel, without personality or thought.

PAD_TempleApproach.speaker: Player
PAD_TempleApproach.text: Piles of bodies - very old, by the looks of them.

session_synopses.PAD_TempleApproach: Party approaches the Shar Temple and notices the Dark Justiciar corpses.

PAD_MintharaReaction.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
PAD_MintharaReaction.text: I wish I could kill that bloated sack of offal, but he may yet help us reach Ketheric.

AD_EnemyVulnerable.speaker: Balthazar
AD_EnemyVulnerable.text: We have the upper hand - do your work, Flesh!

AD_StartTurn.speaker: Balthazar
AD_StartTurn.text: It will be a kindness to put an end to your follies.

Chosen.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen.text: I said you'd be back. Reconsidered my proposition?

Chosen.speaker: Player
Chosen.text: No, I just decided to kill you instead.

Chosen.speaker: Balthazar
Chosen.text: Kill me? Death is my ally, fool.

Barricade.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade.text: You prowl my battleground - why? Are you friend? Foe? Thieving scavenger?

Barricade.speaker: Narrator
Barricade.text: *You find yourself in a dead, putrid skull - somehow hosting a tadpole amongst a squirm of maggots. Another presence lurks within, manipulating the corpse like a puppet.*
Barricade.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld FX. The player winces at the pain of a mindmeld. The skeleton has no visible reaction.

Barricade.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade.text: Ah. A friend - an uninvited friend. I did not request help.

Barricade.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade.text: Who am I really speaking to?

Barricade.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade.text: Come join me and find out. I want to look at you with my own eyes.

Barricade.speaker: Reconstituted Duellist
Barricade.text: Stinking pile of ogre afterbirth! The quakes herald the shadows - they've found me!
Barricade.context: CinematicNodeContext: continues from a cinematic node in which a shadowquake interrupts the dialogue - the quake continues as background noise. If possible visualisation of dust falling might help to sell it.NodeContext: Sudden angry, alarmed outburst. There's an attack imminent

AD_Justiciar_CombatStarts.speaker: Justiciar Avenger
AD_Justiciar_CombatStarts.context: NodeContext: Rasped, wraithlike battle taunt. MER-kul

AD_OutsideRoom.speaker: Balthazar
AD_OutsideRoom.text: Come inside. Then we can talk.
AD_OutsideRoom.context: NodeContext: 'Not now' (returning to his room before he deigns to speak further)

AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_2.speaker: Justiciar Avenger
AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_2.context: NodeContext: Rasped, wraithlike battle taunt, directed at a trespassing necromancer

AD_OrderingGhouls.speaker: Balthazar
AD_OrderingGhouls.text: Embalming fluid, and a pipette. Now.
AD_OrderingGhouls.context: NodeContext: Ordering his ghould minions about

GolemInvitation.speaker: Flesh
GolemInvitation.context: CinematicNodeContext: The door to Balthazar's private chambers open, revealing a flesh golem. It utters a gurgle and beckons the player to enter.InternalNodeContext: Note - if the flesh golem is somehow unavailable, an alternate invitation will trigger with the necormancer instead.

session_synopses.PAD_MintharaReaction: When dialogue with Balthazar ends (or his projection that delivers the narrative bit) this PAD is played by Minthara in party.
session_synopses.AD_EnemyVulnerable: Balthazar orders his flesh golem to attack his enemy while they're vulnerable
session_synopses.AD_StartTurn: Balthazar gloats at and taunts the player before acting during his turn
session_synopses.AD_GolemDead: Balthazar is angry at his flesh golem being killed
session_synopses.Chosen: The player meets Balthazar, the necromancer, in his temporary command centre in the Shar temple. They find him at an altar, repairing one of his damaged undead, while other minions bustle around. Balthazar has been sent by Ketheric Thorm to recover Nightsong, but has been unable to clear a path to her vault. He decides to recruit the player, upon recognising them as tadpoled. The player can agree or decline, and can possibly persuade him to loan his flesh golem to aid their exploration.
session_synopses.AD_Death: Balthazar's final words as he dies
session_synopses.Barricade: The player is challenged by some skeleton warriors at a barricade outside the Necromancer's lair. The necromancer speaks through the dead warriors - his words in their dessicated voices.(this mayor may not follow on from an earlier scene with more skeletons controlled by the necromancer). A mindmeld convinces the necromancer to command his skeletons to grant entry. The scene ends with combat with the skeletons, or a shadowquake triggering a fight between player (+ skeletons) against sharran wraiths. Afterwards, the player is invited into Balthazar's inner sanctum.
session_synopses.AD_Justiciar_CombatStarts: Justiciar that attacks Balthazar in his lair in Shar temple. Need to have same or similar voice to other Dark Justiciars
session_synopses.AD_OutsideRoom: Balthazar has left his room, and Nightsong's prison is still locked. He won't speak to palyers outside the safety of his room
session_synopses.FleshGolem: Short dialog where the player can interact with Balthazar's flesh golem. Incapable of speech, it utters a moaning sound.
session_synopses.AD_DominateGolem: Balthazar scolds his flesh golem as he calms it down
session_synopses.AD_GhoulSnarl: One of the necromancer's ghoul servants barks a short, guttural warning if the player gets too close.
session_synopses.AD_Justiciar_TakingTurn_2: Justiciar that attacks Balthazar in his lair in Shar temple. Need to have same or similar voice to other Dark Justiciars
session_synopses.AD_OrderingGhouls: Balthazar gives some orders to his ghouls while in the Shar temple. He tells them to fetch things related to his necromancy (he's busy repairing some of his undead troops)
session_synopses.GolemInvitation: Balthazar's private chambers are unlocked and his flesh golem invites the players inside to talk
session_synopses.AD_BarricadeLeader: The lead skeleton defending Balthazar's room will attempt to grab the players' attention

PAD_Prayer.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Prayer.text: Just a little bit farther. See my actions, Lady Shar. Hear my words of faith.
PAD_Prayer.context: NodeContext: Urging herself on. Final descent

AD_MartialPlaque.speaker: Narrator
AD_MartialPlaque.text: *Deliver the Night Mother's mercy upon her enemies.*

AD_NecroUnavailable.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NecroUnavailable.text: I smell the stink of Balthazar. Bring him to me.
AD_NecroUnavailable.context: NodeContext: She can do an ostentatiouse 'sniff' sound like a pro wrestler insulting an enemy

AD_EntrancePlaque.speaker: Narrator
AD_EntrancePlaque.text: *Spill the blood of Selûne and rise a warrior of Shar.*
AD_EntrancePlaque.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player didn't already know Nightsong was a living beingNodeContext: The text of a plaque, instructing initiates in a sharran rite.

ArriveAtShadowfell.speaker: Shadowheart
ArriveAtShadowfell.text: Lady Shar... I can feel her all around. This is her domain. This is the Shadowfell.

ArriveAtShadowfell.speaker: Balthazar
ArriveAtShadowfell.text: You cleared the way for me, True Soul. What promising flesh you are. As a reward, I shall let you bear witness to my masterpiece.
ArriveAtShadowfell.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Please restrict hip and leg movement for this line. He will be floating as he speaks.

Balthazar appears behind the player through the entrance from Shar Temple to Nightsong's prison. He's levitating and reaches their side before they can react, InternalNodeContext: Fallback - haven't met balthazar in person or agreed to helpNodeContext: High-handed, pleased with himself

ArriveAtShadowfell.speaker: Shadowheart
ArriveAtShadowfell.text: This is the Dark Lady's domain - he does not belong here.
ArriveAtShadowfell.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player re: Balthazar. Disdain.

AD_Plaque3.speaker: Narrator
AD_Plaque3.text: *In her blood be anointed: Dark Justiciar.*

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong.text: Balthazar. Come to add more bars to my cage.
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext: She paces the narrow cage where she's kept, like a tiger. She looks down as she paces, not yet deigning to make eye contact.

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong.text: Or perhaps to lead this would-be Justiciar's blade directly to my heart?
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext:  On "this Justiciar"," abruptly turns to the player and points an accusing finger. As she moves forward out of position, magical hands grab around her wrists arms and shoulers, holding her back. She looks down at them and grimaces in rage, then steps back into place. This is how she's bound: If she moves too far, she'll be pulled back by the magi-hands.

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong.text: I invite you: heap more sins upon your head. My retribution will be all the sweeter for them.
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stock still. Cold. Staring Balthazar dead in the eyes.NodeContext: With a deep, seething foreboding

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong.text: All this time, and you still fail to appreciate the gifts I bestowed on you, Aylin. Sad, to see a thing of beauty not recognise its own worth.
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext: Displeased poutNodeContext: A little displeased and admonishing

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong.text: But General Thorm - he appreciates you. And he wants you close at hand, so I am here to whisk you back to him.
NecroAndNightsong.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brightening upNodeContext: Tone brightening up a little

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
NecroAndNightsong.text: Ketheric. I welcome the sight of him, after these hundred years. He whose immortality I supply with my very soul.
NecroAndNightsong.context: NodeContext: She spits on the floor of her cage after 'Ketheric'

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong.text: General. Thorm. I'm sure you'll be on your best behaviour for him. But just in case, I've taken some precautions.

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
NecroAndNightsong.text: Keep back. It will take quite some concentration to secure Aylin for her little journey.

NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Shadowheart
NecroAndNightsong.text: The Nightsong is Shar's sacrifice - she's my destiny. He cannot have her!
NecroAndNightsong.context: NodeContext: Urgent. Her sacred mission is in jeopardy

PAD_ShadowfellEntrance.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowfellEntrance.text: This must be where initiates undertook their final preparations. The end is near.
PAD_ShadowfellEntrance.context: NodeContext: Focus/mounting anticipation. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

GatherYourParty.speaker: Narrator
GatherYourParty.text: *You must gather your party before venturing forth.*

PAD_FalseNightSpear.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_FalseNightSpear.text: Used by initiates for the final step to becoming Dark Justiciar... not all were worthy of the Spear of Night, it seems.
PAD_FalseNightSpear.context: NodeContext: Considering a ceremonial spear. Uncanny insight. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

AD_NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAndNightsong.text: As much as I savour our conversations, it's high time we got started.

AD_NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NecroAndNightsong.text: Do what you will. I cannot prevent you. But you know as well as I, I will come for you. One day.

AD_NecroAndNightsong.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAndNightsong.text: Poor child, so enthralled by gory revenge fantasies. You may find yourself disappointed by reality.

AD_VanishingJusticiarChanting.context: NodeContext: whispered prayer/recitation, delivered by a spectral figure

PAD_EnteredShadowfell.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteredShadowfell.text: I feel lighter, unburdened, as if the softest push could send me drifting away.

AD_NecroAtPrisonEntrance.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAtPrisonEntrance.text: Beyond lies Nightsong's sanctum. Soon, you will be privileged to see a true masterwork.

AD_NecroAtPrisonEntrance.speaker: Balthazar
AD_NecroAtPrisonEntrance.text: Come now, do not tarry. Enter the waters.

PAD_ShadowheartBaptism.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBaptism.text: Almost there. I will not fail you, my lady.
PAD_ShadowheartBaptism.context: NodeContext: Quiet determination. Nearing the end of Shar's trials

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1.text: The blood of Selûne? I was expecting we'd find this Nightsong relic, not some sacrifice.

PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2.speaker: Player
PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2.text: Alive - and abandoned in this place for a very long time.

session_synopses.PAD_Prayer: Shadowheart recites verses of a prayer to Shar as she draws closer to Nightsong.This is a prayer that SH may have recited previously, now repeated as SH gets past the final hurdles to fulfill Shar's bidding. Urging herself on for the 'final lap'.
session_synopses.AD_Plaque2: This is a plaque with narrator AD near the soul cage - before the final trial of killing the Selunite to finish Dark Justiciar training. There are total 3 of them so information needs to be divided nicely.
session_synopses.AD_MartialPlaque: Narrator AD to read what is out on the plaque.
session_synopses.AD_NecroUnavailable: Nightsong indicates to the player that she cannot talk while Balthazar is unavailable
session_synopses.AD_EntrancePlaque: The player reads the plaque outside Nightsong's chamber. It instructs them to kill Nightsong in order to become a Dark Justiciar
session_synopses.ArriveAtShadowfell: After the player arrives at Nightsong's prison in the Shadowfell we see Balthazar show up, hot on the player's heels. Balthazar makes his way down towards Nightsong. Variant lines for:1. Met Balthazar in person, agreed to help2. Met Balthazar in person, didn't agree to help 3. Fallback (likely skipped meeting Balthazar)If Balthazar is dead then the player is just shown a cinematic shot of the Shadowfell
session_synopses.AD_Plaque3: This is a plaque with narrator AD near the soul cage - before the final trial of killing the Selunite to finish Dark Justiciar training. There are total 3 of them so information needs to be divided nicely.
session_synopses.NecroAndNightsong: If Balthazar is alive when the player reaches Nightsong, they will encounter a dialogue where Balthazar and Nightsong square off. The player has one last chance to betray Balthazar and prevent him from taking Nightsong to Moonrise.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowfellEntrance: Entered the final hall before entering the shadowfell in the shar temple. The area used to be used for Dark Justiciars to wash themselves, conduct last prayers and arming themselves before entering the waters into the shadowfell.
session_synopses.AD_DarknessPlaque: Narrator AD to read what is out on the plaque.
session_synopses.GatherYourParty: When a player attempts to enter the Shadowfell they will be reminded that they need to have all their party members present.If all their party are present a Ready Check will be started
session_synopses.PAD_FalseNightSpear: Looted fake spear of the night. Used by old justiciars to symbolically kill Nightsong.
session_synopses.AD_NecroAndNightsong: Nightsong and Balthazar banter before the player arrives into the Shadowfell.
session_synopses.AD_VanishingJusticiarChanting: The Dark Justiciars in Nightsong's Prison can be found nonverbally chanting
session_synopses.PAD_EnteredShadowfell: PAD that plays after the end the cinematic upon entering the shadowfell in Nightsong's prison. Calls out to the player that they can jump down to the platforms below safely.
session_synopses.AD_NecroAtPrisonEntrance: Balthazar tells the player to enter the water to reach Nightsong's prison. He insists that the player goes first.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBaptism: Shadowheart's response to SHA_VoiceOfShar_AD_Baptism if she is nearby. Reaffirming her dedication to become a Dark Justiciar
session_synopses.PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1: The player has read the plaque outside the entrance to Nightsong's Prison and are reacting appropriately:- if they are Shadowheart and have Shar's spear- if they are Shadowheart and do not have Shar's spear- if they already knew Nightsong was a person- if they did not know Nightsong was a person
session_synopses.PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2: The player has read the plaque outside the entrance to Nightsong's Prison and the characters are reacting appropriately:- discovering Nightsong is a living being for the first time- confirming that same fact after learning it elsewhere- if Shadowheart, iterating her desire to sacrifice Nightsong/retrieve the spear required to do so.- reacting to Shadowheart’s desire to sacrifice Nightsong to Shar, with variables depending on if they’re just learning Nightsong is a living being here or not.

PAD_BrokenMirrorOfLoss.speaker: Player
PAD_BrokenMirrorOfLoss.text: There was magic within this mirror once... consuming magic. But it's shattered, now.
PAD_BrokenMirrorOfLoss.context: InternalNodeContext: Played when Medicine check succeeds.NodeContext: Shadowheart: deja vu/slightly unnerved (looking at a broken magical mirror, similar to one that took her memories previously)

session_synopses.PAD_BrokenMirrorOfLoss: In Shar temple HQ player approaches shuttered Mirror of Loss and rolls arcana check

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The bowl contains an ancient, rust-coloured bloodstain. It forms a neat disc, as if spilled calmly and willingly.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks at a large bowl being held by a Shar statue.  Close-up of a dried blood stain in the base of the bowl.

session_synopses: For when a player interacts with the trial statue to being the path of darkness/invisible platform trial.

PAD_VoiceReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_VoiceReaction.text: A voice... is that Shar herself, who speaks...?

AD_TrialIntro.text: Nothing of value comes easy. Overcome my trials, and win my embrace.

AD_Baptism.text: The end draws near. You show great potential - do not falter now.
One more test awaits. Descend to the Nightsong. Make a sacrifice. Rise again a Dark Justiciar.

AD_ProgressionCommentary.text: A poor effort. Perhaps you are not worthy of my embrace, child.

session_synopses.PAD_VoiceReaction: Party reacts to Shar's voice in the temple and acknowledging it is Shar's voice.
session_synopses.AD_TrialIntro: A disembodied voice speaks from a nearby statue. It tells the player that they have arrived at the trial area
session_synopses.AD_Baptism: A disembodied voice congratulates the player for reaching the entrance the inner sanctum of the Shar Temple. It urges the player too step into the water for their final test
session_synopses.AD_ProgressionCommentary: The disembodied voice of the Shar Temple comments on the player's progress. Nodes can be played in any sequence

PAD_AmbushPerceptionCheck.speaker: Player
PAD_AmbushPerceptionCheck.text: There's something out there - I can feel it.

AD_MerregonAndOrthon.speaker: Yurgir
AD_MerregonAndOrthon.text: Keep your weapons sharp - our prey could reveal itself any time.

AD_MerregonAndOrthon.speaker: Yurgir
AD_MerregonAndOrthon.text: Be ready, or I'll kill you myself.

session_synopses.PAD_AmbushPerceptionCheck: Players enter the Orthon's lair and pass the perception check to reveal the ambush.
session_synopses.AD_MerregonAndOrthon: The orthon occasionally speaks to one of his merregon footsoldiers after the trespass scene has ended. The orthon is fed up, irritable, The merregon is incapable of speech and provides only grunts, gasps and involuntary sounds.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The bowl contains an ancient, rust-coloured bloodstain. It forms a neat disc, as if spilled calmly and willingly.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks at a large bowl being held by a Shar statue. Close-up of a dried blood stain in the base of the bowl.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise this as a trial, where initiates would prove themselves to Lady Shar. This one would challenge their combat prowess.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart-only narration. Visuals should favour her here.InternalNodeContext: SH-only narration

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Look upon the statue.
Vanquish your old life to receive my wisdom.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at the Shar statue before them and hear's Shar's disembodied voiceNodeContext: Haunting, disembodied voice offering guidance

session_synopses: For when a player interacts with the statue to begin the double combat trial in the Shar temple.

AD_NightsongAttacked.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongAttacked.text: Unleash your wrath! It only fuels my fury.

CINE_NightsongsFlight.text: CinematicNodeContext: Wide shot of a figure arcing up into sky high above the temple, trailing pure white light. Close-up as Nightsong surveys the shadow-lands, the light intensifying around her as her rage builds. She swoops down, light spreading in her wake as she gathers speed. CU on an overgrown ruin in SCL. Where Nightsong passes, colour and contrast leak back in as the shadows part.
CINE_NightsongsFlight.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide shot of a figure arcing up into sky high above the temple, trailing pure white light. Close-up as Nightsong surveys the shadow-lands, the light intensifying around her as her rage builds. She swoops down, light spreading in her wake as she gathers speed. CU on an overgrown ruin in SCL. Where Nightsong passes, colour and contrast leak back in as the shadows part.

CINE_NightsongsFlight.text:
CinematicNodeContext: Isobel at a window in Last Light, a glow touching her face as she looks up in wonder.
Shot from her POV: Nightsong like a shooting star, opening up a path of light as she streaks towards Moonrise.
CINE_NightsongsFlight.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Isobel at a window in Last Light, a glow touching her face as she looks up in wonder.
Shot from her POV: Nightsong like a shooting star, opening up a path of light as she streaks towards Moonrise.

session_synopses.AD_NightsongAttacked: Nightsong cries in pain as she gets attacked by the player.
